original: 'jig rten pa zhes pa ni khams gsum pa ste nyon mongs pa la nges par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa zhes pa ni khams gsum pa ste nyon mongs pa la nges par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The mundane is the three realms, because of the necessity of being free from the afflictions.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni grol ba ste nyon mongs pa las nges par 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni grol ba ste nyon mongs pa las nges par 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supramundane is liberation, because of the necessity of being free from the afflictions.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni lus la sogs pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni lus la sogs pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba'o //
translated: Miraculous powers are the emanations of body, etc.

original: sogs kyi sgras sems can gyi don dang ye shes dang shes rab dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sogs kyi sgras sems can gyi don dang ye shes dang shes rab dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams bsdus pa'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúetc.‚Äù include the aims of sentient beings, intuition, wisdom, generosity, and so on.

original: sa 'og dang sa steng dang mtho ris rnams ni mtho ris dang bar snang dang sa 'og rnams so //
analyzed: sa 'og dang sa steng dang mtho ris rnams ni mtho ris dang bar snang dang sa 'og rnams so //
translated: The underworld, the earth, and the heavens are the underworld, the sky, and the heavens.

original: bdag ces pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ces pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúself‚Äù is the disciples, etc.

original: gzhan zhes pa ni phyi rol mu stegs can spyod pas grol ba'i don du lus la sogs pa'i bya ba la nan tan du byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes pa ni phyi rol mu stegs can spyod pas grol ba'i don du lus la sogs pa'i bya ba la nan tan du byed pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúother‚Äù is the outsiders, the tƒ´rthikas, who are intent on the practice of the body, etc., for the sake of liberation.

original: spyod pa kun gyis ni gnyis su med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin rnams kyis so //
analyzed: spyod pa kun gyis ni gnyis su med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin rnams kyis so //
translated: By all practices means by those whose nature is the path of nonduality.

original: gal te spyod pa thams cad gnyis su med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe chos kyi don mchog ci ltar mngon par thob par mi 'gyur zhen /
analyzed: gal te spyod pa thams cad gnyis su med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe chos kyi don mchog ci ltar mngon par thob par mi 'gyur zhen /
translated: If all the practices are of the nature of the path of nonduality, then how is the supreme meaning of reality not manifestly attained?

original: rang rang so so tha dad pa'i lam du bsdus pa'i phyir spyod pa rnams kyis tha dad pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang rang so so tha dad pa'i lam du bsdus pa'i phyir spyod pa rnams kyis tha dad pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are included in the individual paths, the practices are attained as distinct.

original: spros pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyud thams cad du rnam pa de lta bu'i thun mong gi spyod pa rnam pa gsum gsungs so //
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyud thams cad du rnam pa de lta bu'i thun mong gi spyod pa rnam pa gsum gsungs so //
translated: The three types of common practice of that kind are taught in all the tantras with elaborate, etc.

original: 'di spros pa med pa dang shin tu spros pa med pa gnyis po nyid gsungs pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams su chags pas spyod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di spros pa med pa dang shin tu spros pa med pa gnyis po nyid gsungs pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams su chags pas spyod par byed do //
translated: Because the absence of elaboration and the utter absence of elaboration are taught, one engages in the practices with attachment to forms, etc.

original: 'gro bar byed do zhes 'chad par 'gyur bzhin pa'i bya ba la 'di dag spyod par byed de zhes pas de nyid spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro bar byed do zhes 'chad par 'gyur bzhin pa'i bya ba la 'di dag spyod par byed de zhes pas de nyid spyod pa'o //
translated: One engages in those that are being explained as the activities of going, etc. Thus, that is the practice.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: It is literal.

original: spyad pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par brjod pa gang gis spyod par bya ba de'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: spyad pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par brjod pa gang gis spyod par bya ba de'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The characteristic of that is stated:

original: rnam par mi rtog ces pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩmchog @80a * //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ces pa la sogs pa'o // mchog @80a * //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-conceptual‚Äù and so forth.

original: ces pa la sogs pas de'i 'bras bu ston par byed do //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pas de'i 'bras bu ston par byed do //
translated: The result of that is taught by ‚Äúsupreme‚Äù and so forth.

original: mchog ces pa la sogs pa de'i spyod pa dang de'i 'bras bu dag theg pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas las 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: mchog ces pa la sogs pa de'i spyod pa dang de'i 'bras bu dag theg pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas las 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: The practice of that and the result of that arise from the state of the special vehicle.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o skye gnas la sogs pa ma yin no zhes pa ni tshul 'di nyid sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o skye gnas la sogs pa ma yin no zhes pa ni tshul 'di nyid sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNot intended‚Äù is not the birthplace and so forth. This method is not the cause of buddhahood.

original: de bzhin du nyan thos kyi theg par yang gdol pa la sogs pas dgra bcom pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan thos kyi theg par yang gdol pa la sogs pas dgra bcom pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle, it is said that even an outcaste and so forth can attain arhatship.

original: bla ma la 'khu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ces pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bla ma la 'khu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ces pa lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTreachery to the guru‚Äù and so forth is ‚Äúaccomplished‚Äù and so forth is the remainder of ‚Äúthe great seal attainment.‚Äù

original: rlung dang 'khrul 'khor dang grib ma'i 'khrul 'khor dang / 'phags pa gsod pa'i thabs nyid longs spyod pa'o zhes rab tu grags so //
analyzed: rlung dang 'khrul 'khor dang grib ma'i 'khrul 'khor dang / 'phags pa gsod pa'i thabs nyid longs spyod pa'o zhes rab tu grags so //
translated: The wind, the machine, the shadow machine, and the method of killing the noble ones are enjoyed.

original: sku gzugs ni dan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa 'byung bar gsungs pa /üîΩsangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku gzugs ni dan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa 'byung bar gsungs pa / sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The image is said to be the arising of the mind of doubt and the shedding of blood.

original: spong ba ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa 'di dag sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: spong ba ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa 'di dag sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba'o //
translated: The Buddha said, Those who say 'this is not the Buddha's teaching' and so on are abandoning the Dharma.

original: dmyal bar ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni de'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmyal bar ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni de'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They will fall into hell.

original: nye ba'i mtshams med pa zhes pa ni 'dis mtshams med pa las nye ba'i mtshams med pa mtshungs pa dang dman pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: nye ba'i mtshams med pa zhes pa ni 'dis mtshams med pa las nye ba'i mtshams med pa mtshungs pa dang dman pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The near-parricides are taught to be equal to and inferior to the parricides.

original: bzhi zhes bya ba ni mi gsod pa dang bud med 'dzin pa dang / pha rol gyi rdzas pa na bzhi cha'i rin thang len pa dang lha mthong ngo //
analyzed: bzhi zhes bya ba ni mi gsod pa dang bud med 'dzin pa dang / pha rol gyi rdzas pa na bzhi cha'i rin thang len pa dang lha mthong ngo //
translated: The four are killing a human, taking a woman, taking a quarter of the value of another's property, and seeing a god.

original: lha rnams nye bar 'ong bar byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi bla ma klog par mngon par brjod pa rnams ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi po rnams zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: lha rnams nye bar 'ong bar byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi bla ma klog par mngon par brjod pa rnams ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi po rnams zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: The four root downfalls are stated in the statement of the worldly guru, The gods will come near, and so forth.

original: rtsa ba ni brtul zhugs can rnams kyis brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: rtsa ba ni brtul zhugs can rnams kyis brtul zhugs so //
translated: The root is the vow of the yogis.

original: sdom pa de'i ltung ba ni 'jig cing gcod pa ste /
analyzed: sdom pa de'i ltung ba ni 'jig cing gcod pa ste /
translated: The downfall of the vow is the destruction and cutting of it.

original: ta la bcad pa bzhin zhes pa ni ta la'i mgo bcad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ta la bcad pa bzhin zhes pa ni ta la'i mgo bcad pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the palm tree when the top is cut, means like the palm tree when the top is cut.

original: slar yang 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad rnams las gzhan du 'bras bu thob pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad rnams las gzhan du 'bras bu thob pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Again, it is stated that no other result is obtained than the eight results, in the verse beginning Buddhahood, and so forth.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud du gsungs pa'i rdo rje slob dpon rnams la smod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang ldan pa rnams ni de rnams 'dir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud du gsungs pa'i rdo rje slob dpon rnams la smod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang ldan pa rnams ni de rnams 'dir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who have the root downfalls called contempt for the vajra master, and so forth, of the yoga tantra, are stated in the verse beginning Those who have the root downfalls, and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni rdo rje @80b 'chang chen po nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni rdo rje @80b 'chang chen po nyid do //
translated: Buddhahood is the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: zang zing zhes pa ni bza' ba dang chos gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing zhes pa ni bza' ba dang chos gos la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMaterial things‚Äù are food, Dharma robes, and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras dgod pa dang sgeg pa dang kun du smra ba dang lhan cig tshogs pa la sogs pa bsdus so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras dgod pa dang sgeg pa dang kun du smra ba dang lhan cig tshogs pa la sogs pa bsdus so //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes laughing, flirting, and socializing.

original: smod par byed pa ni rmi lam du yang zhes pa'i yang sgras nges pa kho na'i don to //
analyzed: smod par byed pa ni rmi lam du yang zhes pa'i yang sgras nges pa kho na'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Disparage‚Äù means to criticize. The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù in ‚Äúeven in a dream‚Äù means ‚Äúcertainly.‚Äù

original: rmi lam nyid du ni rdo rje 'chang de srid du mthong bar 'gyur ba ma yin na slar yang 'di la dngos grub 'byung ba ltag la yod /
analyzed: rmi lam nyid du ni rdo rje 'chang de srid du mthong bar 'gyur ba ma yin na slar yang 'di la dngos grub 'byung ba ltag la yod /
translated: If one does not see Vajradhara even in a dream, how could there be any possibility of accomplishments arising?

original: slar yang 'di dag nyid ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: slar yang 'di dag nyid ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could these very things happen again?

original: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Whatever‚Äù and so on. The words are literal.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po zhes pa ni 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po zhes pa ni 'dus pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú King of tantras‚Äù is Guhyasamaja.

original: khyad par du ni rten no //
analyzed: khyad par du ni rten no //
translated: ‚Äú Especially‚Äù means ‚Äúin particular.‚Äù

original: slob dpon med par zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon med par zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur bzhin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Without a master‚Äù is as will be explained.

original: srog gcod pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Killing‚Äù and so on are literal.

original: gtum pa la sogs pa'i bya ba 'di la ldan bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtum pa la sogs pa'i bya ba 'di la ldan bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because this action of killing and so on is possessed by the state of being.

original: 'di'i don zhes pa ni dgongs pas bshad pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: 'di'i don zhes pa ni dgongs pas bshad pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The meaning of this is that it is of the nature of intentional explanation.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud du ni dgongs pa lung ston du'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud du ni dgongs pa lung ston du'o //
translated: In the explanatory tantra, it is in the SandhivyƒÅkara·πáa.

original: srog gcod byed pa zhes pa ni srog bcad par byas pa yang phung po dang khams la sogs pa rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog gcod byed pa zhes pa ni srog bcad par byas pa yang phung po dang khams la sogs pa rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who performs killing is also one who has killed, because of the non-existence of the entities of the aggregates, elements, and so on.

original: 'jig rten du phyi rol la sogs pa phung po la sogs pa rnams bden pa nyid kyi tha snyad du sgyu ma lta bur bden pa nyid kyis de rtag tu ston par byed pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten du phyi rol la sogs pa phung po la sogs pa rnams bden pa nyid kyi tha snyad du sgyu ma lta bur bden pa nyid kyis de rtag tu ston par byed pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba la dga' ba'o //
translated: In the world, external and so on, the aggregates and so on, are truly conventionally like illusions, by the truth of being. Therefore, he is one who delights in lying.

original: rdzas ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin pa'i phyir zung 'jug go //
analyzed: rdzas ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin pa'i phyir zung 'jug go //
translated: Since substance is ultimate truth, it is union.

original: de 'phrog pa'i dang tshul ni gzhan gyis mi byin pa de la rtag tu dmigs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de 'phrog pa'i dang tshul ni gzhan gyis mi byin pa de la rtag tu dmigs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The manner of stealing it is by always observing that which is not given by another.

original: de bzhin nyid ni bud med de rkyen gyis mngon par brjod pa'i phyir dang / chos dang chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni bud med de rkyen gyis mngon par brjod pa'i phyir dang / chos dang chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Suchness is the woman, because it is expressed by conditions, and because it has the nature of both the object and the subject.

original: mngon par 'dod pa ma lus pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang bde ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di la dmigs pa ni mchog tu 'dod la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa ma lus pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang bde ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di la dmigs pa ni mchog tu 'dod la dga' ba'o //
translated: The supreme joy of desire is the object of that, because it is the cause of all the joys of desire, and because it has the nature of bliss.

original: gci ba zhes pa ni dbang po'i sgra ru brjod par rtogs par bya ste brjod pa phyin ci log ces bya ba la sogs pas gci ba'i sgra sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gci ba zhes pa ni dbang po'i sgra ru brjod par rtogs par bya ste brjod pa phyin ci log ces bya ba la sogs pas gci ba'i sgra sgrub pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúurine‚Äù should be understood as a word for the sense organ, because the word ‚Äúurine‚Äù is established by the phrase ‚Äúthe reversal of expression‚Äù and so on.

original: zhi ba mthar thug ces pa ni yul dang dbang po dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos rab tu 'jug pa dag shes pa dang lhan cig pa dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji lta ba @81a * //
analyzed: zhi ba mthar thug ces pa ni yul dang dbang po dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos rab tu 'jug pa dag shes pa dang lhan cig pa dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji lta ba @81a * //
translated: The ultimate peace is the object of that, because the object and the sense organ, which function as the grasped and the grasper, are together with consciousness, and they are dependently arisen, just as they are.

original: bzhin du brtag par bya'o zhes pa theg pa chen po bsgrub pa la ni phyag rgya chen po sgrub pa 'di la'o zhes pa de 'dir gsungs so //
analyzed: bzhin du brtag par bya'o zhes pa theg pa chen po bsgrub pa la ni phyag rgya chen po sgrub pa 'di la'o zhes pa de 'dir gsungs so //
translated: Thus, in this way means in the manner of the great seal, and should be examined means should be investigated. In the accomplishment of the Great Vehicle means in the accomplishment of the great seal. This is what is said here.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the intended meaning.

original: mnyes par bya zhes pa ni rang bzhin yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: mnyes par bya zhes pa ni rang bzhin yongs su shes pas so //
translated: The phrase should be pleased means by thorough knowledge of the nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: rgya chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgya chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The great seal, and so on.

original: gang la ltos nas rgya che zhe na /
analyzed: gang la ltos nas rgya che zhe na /
translated: With respect to what is it great?üîΩ It is said:

original: gsungs pa theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Great Vehicle, and so on.

original: theg pa chen po'i mchog gi chos mdo sde mngon par brjod pa'am //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mchog gi chos mdo sde mngon par brjod pa'am //
translated: The supreme Dharma of the Great Vehicle is the sutra expression,

original: bskyed pa'i rim pas mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pas mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: or the expression of the creation stage.

original: slar yang dgongs pa gang gis ma la sogs pa brjod pa rjes su mthun pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis phyag rgya mngon par brjod par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: slar yang dgongs pa gang gis ma la sogs pa brjod pa rjes su mthun pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis phyag rgya mngon par brjod par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Again, by what intention is the expression of the mother, and so on, said to be endowed with the quality of being in accord with the great seal?

original: rjes su mi mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mi mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The expression not in accord with and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyir pa zhes pa ni de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyir pa zhes pa ni de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of that is ‚Äúperfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: snying la gnas pa zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i thugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: snying la gnas pa zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i thugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding in the heart‚Äù means abiding in the heart of the gnosis being.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni sku mdog dmar po phyag gnyis pa yang ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni sku mdog dmar po phyag gnyis pa yang ste /
translated: Moreover, she is red-colored and has two arms.

original: phyi rol gyi bud med las skyes pa'i mi mo yang de dag rnal 'byor pa'i yid la bud med kyi rnam pa de yang phyag gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bud med las skyes pa'i mi mo yang de dag rnal 'byor pa'i yid la bud med kyi rnam pa de yang phyag gnyis pa'o //
translated: The woman born from an external woman is also of that form, with two arms, in the mind of the yogin.

original: rnam pa gzhan du yang rnal 'byor pa'i snying la gnas pa gang yin pa de bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang rnal 'byor pa'i snying la gnas pa gang yin pa de bsam par bya'o //
translated: In another way, that which abides in the heart of the yogin should be contemplated.

original: gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni thams cad gsang bar ro //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni thams cad gsang bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is said‚Äù means in the Tantra of the All-Secret.

original: lung gi bshad pa ni dgongs pa lung bstan par bshad pa nyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung gi bshad pa ni dgongs pa lung bstan par bshad pa nyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The explanation of the scripture is that it is explained in the Sutra of the Prediction of Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´‚Äôs Buddhahood.

original: de bzhin nyid ni mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: Suchness is the expression.üîΩThe enjoyment of the nondual union with that is the enjoyment body.

original: lhan cig gnyis su med par sbyor ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa de'o / de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: lhan cig gnyis su med par sbyor ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa de'o / de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúenjoyment body‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: sngags kyi sku zhes pa ni mdor byas kyi rim par mngon par brjod pa gang yin pa'o // longs spyod rdzogs dang mnyam pa gang //

original: zhes pa la sogs pa snga mar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa snga mar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEqual to the enjoyment body‚Äù and so on is to be applied as before.

original: gang yang ye shes kyi skus bslang ba mi bskyod pa rjes su zhugs pas mngon par brjod pa gang yin pa de rang ste bdag nyid gang yin pa'i lhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor de dang ldan pa'o /
analyzed: gang yang ye shes kyi skus bslang ba mi bskyod pa rjes su zhugs pas mngon par brjod pa gang yin pa de rang ste bdag nyid gang yin pa'i lhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor de dang ldan pa'o /
translated: Also, the mantra body is the recitation that is aroused by the gnosis body and is entered by Ak·π£obhya.

analyzed: sgrub pa po zhes pa la sogs pas sngags kyi sku nyid mngon par brjod do //
translated: The ‚Äúmantra body‚Äù and so on is stated by the practitioner and so on.

original: mnyes par bya ni dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyes par bya ni dmigs par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be pleased‚Äù is to be visualized.

original: 'di 'dra ni chos la sogs pa'i sku @81b gsum gyi mtshan nyid can sring mo zhes pa la sogs pas drang ba'i don du gsungs pa //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ni chos la sogs pa'i sku @81b gsum gyi mtshan nyid can sring mo zhes pa la sogs pas drang ba'i don du gsungs pa //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù is stated in the interpretable meaning as having the character of the three bodies of Dharma and so on.

original: sring mo la sogs pa'i yang dag pa'i don to //
analyzed: sring mo la sogs pa'i yang dag pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúSister‚Äù and so on is the interpretable meaning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: All the Tathagatas are Akshobhya and so forth.

original: de rnams 'phags par gyur pa ni rje bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'phags par gyur pa ni rje bor gyur pa'o //
translated: They are the Lords, having become Noble.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams te rin po che'i gnag zag go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams te rin po che'i gnag zag go //

original: ma rdzogs pa ni padma dkar po la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ma rdzogs pa ni padma dkar po la sogs pa rnams so //

analyzed: don ni bshad zin to zhes pa ni dang por brjod pa'i ni sogs pa ni lhag par rtogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The meaning has been explained, the first one and so forth, the nature of the realization of the rest.

original: 'gag cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid rtse gcig pa nyid la sogs pa'i don bshad pa ste rnam par gzhan du na yid rtse gcig pa nyid du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gag cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid rtse gcig pa nyid la sogs pa'i don bshad pa ste rnam par gzhan du na yid rtse gcig pa nyid du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of one-pointedness of mind and so forth is explained by the words ‚Äúceasing‚Äù and so forth, because it arises as one-pointedness of mind in another way.

original: mi g-yo ba 'di zhes bya ba'i gang du yang kun du chags pa med pa'i phyir bden pa gnyis po la yang rang bzhin gyis dngos po med cing de'i 'bras bu la yang mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba 'di zhes bya ba'i gang du yang kun du chags pa med pa'i phyir bden pa gnyis po la yang rang bzhin gyis dngos po med cing de'i 'bras bu la yang mi gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the immovability, because there is no attachment anywhere, and the two truths are also naturally unreal, and the result of that is also not present.

original: gsang ba ni skal pa med pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ni skal pa med pa rnams la'o //

original: zhi ba ni de bzhin nyid dang lhan cig gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni de bzhin nyid dang lhan cig gcig tu gyur pa'o //

original: ma bcos pa'i mchog gi bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir bde ba'i mchog ces pa bde ba gzhan la ltos nas so //
analyzed: ma bcos pa'i mchog gi bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir bde ba'i mchog ces pa bde ba gzhan la ltos nas so //
translated: Since it is the nature of the supreme bliss that is uncontrived, it is the supreme bliss, in dependence on other types of bliss.

original: dgongs pas zhes pa ni dgongs pas gsungs pas gsungs pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas zhes pa ni dgongs pas gsungs pas gsungs pas so //

original: 'di ni zhes pa lam gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa lam gyi ngo bo'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /

original: yang dag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag ces pa la sogs pa'o //

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin nyid rmad du byung ba ste gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid rgyu mtha' yas ba bzhin du mtha' yas pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin nyid rmad du byung ba ste gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid rgyu mtha' yas ba bzhin du mtha' yas pa nyid du ston par byed do //

original: de rnams nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Those very things are forms, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par bshad pa ni /

analyzed: de bzhin nyid las 'ongs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang skyes pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: byang chub sems dpa' skye mched la sogs pa de rnams nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' skye mched la sogs pa de rnams nyid do //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gsungs pa yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod par bya'o rjod par bya'o rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gsungs pa yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod par bya'o rjod par bya'o rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma yin no zhes so //

original: de bzhin du @82a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du @82a * //
translated: In the same way,

analyzed: khams la sogs pa rnams kyang bshad par bya'o //
translated: the elements, etc. should be explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa //
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That itself, etc.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo bshad ma thag pa ni dkyil 'khor de'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo bshad ma thag pa ni dkyil 'khor de'o //

original: rang lus gang yin pa zhes pa ni rten rang gi lus dang brten pas gzugs la sogs pa byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang lus gang yin pa zhes pa ni rten rang gi lus dang brten pas gzugs la sogs pa byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbye bas 'jig pa nyid du 'dir rtog par byed do zhes pa gang yin pa de rnams 'jig tshogs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbye bas 'jig pa nyid du 'dir rtog par byed do zhes pa gang yin pa de rnams 'jig tshogs so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is form, etc., and the differentiation of the TathƒÅgatas, is here imagined to be destruction.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams nye bar mtshon pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams kyang de bzhin pa rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams nye bar mtshon pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams kyang de bzhin pa rnams te /

original: de'i tshe yid gnyis la ltos pas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe yid gnyis la ltos pas so //
translated: At that time, because of the doubt,

original: de lta'i ni gsungs pa'i rim pas gzugs la sogs pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta'i ni gsungs pa'i rim pas gzugs la sogs pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: in that way, by the sequence of the teaching, form, etc. are shown to be the TathƒÅgata.

original: gang las ma shes she na /
analyzed: gang las ma shes she na /
translated: From what is it not known?

original: gsungs pa / bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste bde ba ni 'jig rten pa'i bde ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsungs pa / bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste bde ba ni 'jig rten pa'i bde ba'i don to //
translated: It is said: ‚Äúhappiness,‚Äù etc. Happiness is the meaning of worldly happiness.

original: brgyal ba ni rnam par g-yengs pa'o //
analyzed: brgyal ba ni rnam par g-yengs pa'o //
translated: Stupefied is distracted.

original: rmongs pa ni blun par byas pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa ni blun par byas pa'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa //
translated: Therefore it is said:

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs ni mi shes pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of ignorance is stated by the words ‚Äúthe Bodhisattva,‚Äù etc.

original: nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to //
translated: The definitive meaning is stated by the words ‚Äúthe Bodhisattva,‚Äù etc.

original: bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir dang / gnyis su med pa ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir rnams pa gzhan du na 'jig rten pa dang 'byung pa gnyis po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir dang / gnyis su med pa ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir rnams pa gzhan du na 'jig rten pa dang 'byung pa gnyis po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The two truths are not two, because of the nature of non-duality, and because of the absence of attachment to non-duality.

original: snyoms par zhugs so zhes pa bcom ldan 'das zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs so zhes pa bcom ldan 'das zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚Äú Entered into the samƒÅdhi‚Äù is the remainder of the words ‚Äúthe BhagavƒÅn.‚Äù

original: don ni bshad zin to zhes de ma thag nyid du'o //
analyzed: don ni bshad zin to zhes de ma thag nyid du'o //
translated: The meaning has been explained, immediately.

original: nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pas de lta bur gyur pa'i zhes pa de lta bu'i sgra sngar gsungs pa dang so sor sbyor ro / de bzhin nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya ba'i don ston par byed pa dran pa slar zhes
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pas de lta bur gyur pa'i zhes pa de lta bu'i sgra sngar gsungs pa dang so sor sbyor ro / de bzhin nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya ba'i don ston par byed pa dran pa slar zhes
translated: ‚Äú Space-like‚Äù and so forth. ‚Äú Such‚Äù is the word that is applied to the previously stated. The meaning of ‚Äúentered into the samƒÅdhi of suchness‚Äù is taught by the words ‚Äúmindfulness,‚Äù etc.

original: bya ba la sogs te bskyed pa'i rim pa la ltos nas gsungs so //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs te bskyed pa'i rim pa la ltos nas gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in terms of the creation stage.

original: drangs ba'i don to //
analyzed: drangs ba'i don to //
translated: is the meaning of the quotation.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa //
translated: In order to explain the meaning of ‚Äúspace‚Äù and so on, he says:

original: nam mkha' zhes pa ste nam mkha' @82b lta bu ni nam mkha' ste ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dang gzhan dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa ste nam mkha' @82b lta bu ni nam mkha' ste ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dang gzhan dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Space is like space, because it is devoid of intrinsic reality and because it is free from otherness.

original: stong pa gsum ni stong pa dang shin du stong pa dang stong pa chen po'o //
analyzed: stong pa gsum ni stong pa dang shin du stong pa dang stong pa chen po'o //
translated: The three voids are void, void of void, and void of great void.

original: de'i mnyam pa nyid ni 'od gsal la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mnyam pa nyid ni 'od gsal la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Their sameness is the entry into clearlight.

original: de'i 'og tu ldang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ldang ba'i phyir /
translated: After that, because of the arising,

original: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says ‚Äúthose‚Äù and so on.

original: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba sogs pas phyi dang nang gi yul rnams la rab tu mi 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba sogs pas phyi dang nang gi yul rnams la rab tu mi 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can nyid du gsungs so //
translated: By ‚Äúimmovable‚Äù and so on, he teaches the nature of non-engagement with external and internal objects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBodhisattvas‚Äù and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, he says:

original: rang gi bdag nyid du zhes pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid du'o //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid du zhes pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn their own nature‚Äù means in the nature of the Bodhisattvas themselves.

original: bdag nyid ces pa ldang ba'i bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid do //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces pa ldang ba'i bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúIn their own nature‚Äù means in the nature of the arising of Great Vajradhara himself.

original: de'i don 'di yin te rdo rje 'chang chen po'i spyan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: de'i don 'di yin te rdo rje 'chang chen po'i spyan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: This is the meaning: the Bodhisattvas are the nature of the eyes, etc. of Great Vajradhara.

original: de stong pa gsum gyi rim gyis 'od gsal du zhugs pa na /
analyzed: de stong pa gsum gyi rim gyis 'od gsal du zhugs pa na /
translated: When he enters into clear light by the process of the three voids,

original: de rnams kyang 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: de rnams kyang 'jug par byed de /
translated: they also enter.

original: 'di rnams longs spyod rdzogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams longs spyod rdzogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are not different from the Enjoyment Body.

original: slar yang rdo rje 'chang chen po de langs pa na byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: slar yang rdo rje 'chang chen po de langs pa na byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o ;
translated: When he, Great Vajradhara, arises again, those Bodhisattvas also arise.

original: / brjod pa'i don 'di nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: / brjod pa'i don 'di nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He states the meaning of this:

original: de ma thag tu zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ma thag tu zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúImmediately‚Äù and so forth.

original: snyoms par zhugs bzhes pa 'od gsal las langs btsam gyi'o //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs bzhes pa 'od gsal las langs btsam gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving entered into union‚Äù means having arisen from clear light.

original: 'di nyid kyi don gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi don gsungs pa /
translated: He states the meaning of this:

original: byas pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'od kyi zhes pa bya ba la sogs pas ldang ba'i rim pa nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: byas pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'od kyi zhes pa bya ba la sogs pas ldang ba'i rim pa nyid ston par byed do //
translated: The and so on refers to the light and so on. This teaches the process of arising.

original: snang pa'i tshogs kyis zhes pa ni rlung dang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: snang pa'i tshogs kyis zhes pa ni rlung dang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The aggregate of appearances is the nature of wind and consciousness.

original: de la rlung gi bdag nyid gsungs pa reg pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rlung gi bdag nyid gsungs pa reg pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, the nature of wind is stated with touch and so on.

original: 'di rnam par shes pa dang 'brel par gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di rnam par shes pa dang 'brel par gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in connection with consciousness.

original: khams phra ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khams phra ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The subtle element and so on.

original: rang rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rang rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Each one and so on.

original: 'dir gnas par bya /
analyzed: 'dir gnas par bya /
translated: Here, one should abide,

original: dmigs par bya /
analyzed: dmigs par bya /
translated: one should visualize,

original: gzhag par bya'o zhes pas bstan te yul rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: gzhag par bya'o zhes pas bstan te yul rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: one should place, and so on are taught as the five types of objects.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi 'jig rten gyi khams ji lta ba de rnams su ngas pa ni lha'i mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi 'jig rten gyi khams ji lta ba de rnams su ngas pa ni lha'i mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: For that very reason, as in my own world is the nature of the divine eye and so on.

original: sems can rnams ni de dang de'i rigs dang @83a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni de dang de'i rigs dang @83a * //
translated: Sentient beings are of that and that type.

original: khams dang rang bzhin dang dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pas nye bar dmigs te 'di rnams kyi don bya ba ni yongs su smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa rdzogs par byed par nus so //
analyzed: khams dang rang bzhin dang dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pas nye bar dmigs te 'di rnams kyi don bya ba ni yongs su smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa rdzogs par byed par nus so //
translated: The realm is the realm of sentient beings, and the nature is the nature of the three vehicles. The virtuous and non-virtuous are the virtuous and non-virtuous actions of sentient beings. The various refers to the various realms, natures, virtuous and non-virtuous actions, and so on. The object is the object of those actions. The purpose is the ability to accomplish the complete ripening and liberation of those objects.

original: yang dag par skyes pa zhes bya ba 'dis bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis nus gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag par skyes pa zhes bya ba 'dis bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis nus gsungs so //
translated: The phrase truly arisen indicates that the Blessed One himself has the ability.

original: yang na mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i 'khor du gyur pa'i sems dpa' rnams ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnam par 'phrul ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid do //üîΩbdag nyid thob par gyur to ni ldang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: yang na mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i 'khor du gyur pa'i sems dpa' rnams ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnam par 'phrul ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid do // bdag nyid thob par gyur to ni ldang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: Alternatively, the bodhisattvas who are in the retinue of the immovable samadhi are of the nature of the emanations of Great Vajradhara, and therefore they are of the nature of Great Vajradhara.üîΩThe phrase I have attained indicates that they are of the nature of Great Vajradhara, because they have the essence of arising.

original: de'i bdag nyid du ldang bar byas pa ni gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du ldang bar byas pa ni gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase I have become indicates that they have arisen in the nature of Great Vajradhara.

original: de'i man dag sbyin pa ni rang gi bdag po 'am de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: de'i man dag sbyin pa ni rang gi bdag po 'am de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The others are either their own lords or the bodhisattvas who are below them.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThus, etc.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste nges pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúsentient beings, etc.‚Äù

original: ston pa zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rang gi ngo bor byas nas so sor bstan pa nyid gdul bya rnams la ston par byas pa nyid du mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rang gi ngo bor byas nas so sor bstan pa nyid gdul bya rnams la ston par byas pa nyid du mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Teacher, having made the Lord his own essence, is said to be the one who teaches the disciples, because he is the one who reveals.

original: rmad du byung ba zhes pa ni tshig gis thung du nyid do //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba zhes pa ni tshig gis thung du nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúMarvelous‚Äù is the brevity of the words.

original: kun du 'khor ba ni yang dag par sngar gnas pa'i bde bas gnas skabs de g-yo bar byed cing 'khor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun du 'khor ba ni yang dag par sngar gnas pa'i bde bas gnas skabs de g-yo bar byed cing 'khor bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWandering‚Äù means that he moves and wanders from the state of abiding in the bliss of his former abode.

original: bka' stsal pa zhes pa la sog pa ni g-yo ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa zhes pa la sog pa ni g-yo ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe said‚Äù is the cause of the movement.

original: sngar gyi gnas skabs rnam pa ci lta bu las rnam pa gzhan nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sngar gyi gnas skabs rnam pa ci lta bu las rnam pa gzhan nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: From what kind of former state does he change to another state?

original: gsungs pa / 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad bzhin no //
analyzed: gsungs pa / 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad bzhin no //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThus, etc.‚Äù, as will be explained.

original: de 'byung ba ni rjod byed dang brjod bya thos pa dang bsam pa la dmigs pa las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de 'byung ba ni rjod byed dang brjod bya thos pa dang bsam pa la dmigs pa las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Its arising is the attention born from hearing and reflection on the expressions and the expressed.

original: de gang yin zhes pa la sogs pas de'i rang gi ngo bo ston par byed do //
analyzed: de gang yin zhes pa la sogs pas de'i rang gi ngo bo ston par byed do //
translated: As for what is that? and so forth, it shows its own nature.

original: rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lnga'o//
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lnga'o//
translated: The vajra and so forth are the five Tathagatas, Akshobhya and so forth.

original: bdag po ni de dag byin gyis rlob par byed pas phung po lnga bskyed pa dang de dag mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pas de rnams ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag po ni de dag byin gyis rlob par byed pas phung po lnga bskyed pa dang de dag mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pas de rnams ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lord is the one who empowers them, because he generates the five aggregates and causes them to transcend suffering, and because of the reversal of those.

original: phyag 'tshal ba ni nges par brjod pa la gnyis so //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba ni nges par brjod pa la gnyis so //
translated: The homage is twofold in the declaration.

original: sku la sogs pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir gyur pa lus ni sems kyi rnam pas zhes bya ba @83b la sogs pa'i tshul gyis tha dad pa nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir gyur pa lus ni sems kyi rnam pas zhes bya ba @83b la sogs pa'i tshul gyis tha dad pa nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body and so forth are not different, because they are the cause of generating the body and so forth, in the manner of the body is the form of the mind and so forth.

original: phan tshun ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku las so //
analyzed: phan tshun ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku las so //
translated: The mutual is from the body of Great Vajradhara.

original: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for his and so forth,

original: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the nature of the wisdom body.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa dag gi rnam 'gyur yin pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa dag gi rnam 'gyur yin pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Because they are the transformations of birth and cessation, it is said:

original: skye ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBirth‚Äù and so forth.

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo las gsungs pa'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs par rab tu grags pa rnams bsags pa dang nges par bsags pa rnams kyis thugs so //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo las gsungs pa'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs par rab tu grags pa rnams bsags pa dang nges par bsags pa rnams kyis thugs so //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù and so forth refers to the thirty-two major marks and so forth, which are well-known as taught in the MahƒÅyƒÅna s≈´tra called the DhƒÅra·πáƒ´≈õvararƒÅja.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lnga po rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lnga po rnams so //
translated: The tathƒÅgatas are the five, Ak·π£obhya and so forth.

original: ye shes kyi sku'i dbyings su bsdus pa'i bar ma chad pa'i bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku'i dbyings su bsdus pa'i bar ma chad pa'i bskyed pa'o //
translated: They are generated without interruption in the realm of the wisdom body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsungs pa dang por gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsungs pa dang por gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because the tathƒÅgatas are the first to speak, and so forth.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid can yin pa nyid kyi phyir dus gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir 'di la rgyud gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid can yin pa nyid kyi phyir dus gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de nyid kyi phyir 'di la rgyud gsungs pa /
translated: Because the past and future are of the nature of Great Vajradhara, it is said the three times, and so forth.

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, the tantra is taught here, beginning with all.

original: stong pa gsum snang ba la ltobs pa gsung pa chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa gsum snang ba la ltobs pa gsung pa chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three voids are dependent on appearance. It is said great speech, and so forth.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir khams gsum pa'o //üîΩnam mkhar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir khams gsum pa'o // nam mkhar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Because of being the nature of the realms of desire and so forth, it is the three realms.

original: nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because of possessing the magic power of moving in space, and so forth, it is said space, and so forth.

original: nam mkha' bzhin zhes pa ni dang zhing thogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dang 'gro ba rnams kyang gcig tu snang ba'i go skabs sbyin pa'i rgyu skabs sbyin pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin zhes pa ni dang zhing thogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dang 'gro ba rnams kyang gcig tu snang ba'i go skabs sbyin pa'i rgyu skabs sbyin pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like space, it is clear and unobstructed, and it is the cause of giving the opportunity for the appearance of beings as one, because it is the cause of giving the opportunity.

original: nam mkha' ni thams cad du mnyam pa nyid dang thun mong ba'i spyi yin pas nam mkha'i lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni thams cad du mnyam pa nyid dang thun mong ba'i spyi yin pas nam mkha'i lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: Space is the common universal of all sameness, and so it is said, ‚Äúthe path of space,‚Äù and so on.

original: ma lus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gnas zhes pa ni gzhi ste bskyed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gnas zhes pa ni gzhi ste bskyed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: ‚Äú Ground‚Äù means basis, the cause of generation.

original: bya ba sgrub pas ni rang bzhin med par bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pas ni rang bzhin med par bskyed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú By the accomplishment of action‚Äù means by the generation of the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: 'di rnams kyi zhes pa la rigs lnga'i bdag nyid can rnams kyis me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can @84a * //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi zhes pa la rigs lnga'i bdag nyid can rnams kyis me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can @84a * //
translated: ‚Äú By these‚Äù means by those whose nature is the five clans, the five intuitions whose nature is the mirror intuition, etc., the nature of Vairochana, etc.,

original: nyid kyis so //
analyzed: nyid kyis so //
translated: by their own nature.üîΩ‚Äú The best of self and other,‚Äù etc.

original: bdag dang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de nyid mchog ni spyod pa gzhan ma lus pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de nyid mchog ni spyod pa gzhan ma lus pa la ltos nas so //
translated: The best of those is the best of all other practices.

original: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa la bdag ni bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa la bdag ni bdag nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú Self‚Äù is one‚Äôs own person.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i lha dang bdag phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin pa'i lus la sogs par yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i lha dang bdag phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin pa'i lus la sogs par yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The consecration is the thorough knowledge of the body, etc. , as the illusory deity and oneself as not mutually different.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa po'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa po'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: Having taken up the position of the meditator on the creation stage, he says:

original: sku la sogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste lus dang dag kyang rnam shes kyi phung po la phal pa'i dngos pos yos pa thams cad ces pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste lus dang dag kyang rnam shes kyi phung po la phal pa'i dngos pos yos pa thams cad ces pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The body, etc. , and also the aggregate of consciousness, all the things of the world, are the mandala of the body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas.

original: gsang ba ni skal ba med pa rnams la sba bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ni skal ba med pa rnams la sba bar bya'o //
translated: The secret is to be kept from those who are not fit vessels.

original: der byin gyis rlob par byed pa ni /
analyzed: der byin gyis rlob par byed pa ni /
translated: The consecration there is

original: rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la de'i bdag nyid kyis mi bskyod pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la de'i bdag nyid kyis mi bskyod pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: the generation of Akshobhya in the nature of that in the continuum of the yogi.

original: sngags ni yid ngan 'gro'i 'ching ba las grol ba nyid kyi phyir yid skyob pa'o //
analyzed: sngags ni yid ngan 'gro'i 'ching ba las grol ba nyid kyi phyir yid skyob pa'o //
translated: The mantra is the protection of the mind because it is the liberation of the mind from the bondage of bad transmigrations.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa pa rnams kyis so sor gnyis su med pa'i lam sbyin pa ni sngags so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa pa rnams kyis so sor gnyis su med pa'i lam sbyin pa ni sngags so //
translated: The mantra for those on the perfection stage is the giving of the path of non-duality.

original: de nyid thogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje thugs ni rnal 'byor pa'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid thogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje thugs ni rnal 'byor pa'i'o //
translated: The vajra mind of the yogi is because of the very non-obstruction of that.

original: byin gyis rlob pa ni mi bskyod pa'i bdag nyid du bskyed par bya ba gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa ni mi bskyod pa'i bdag nyid du bskyed par bya ba gang yin pa de de bzhin no //
translated: The empowerment is just as it is to be generated as the nature of Akshobhya.

original: yid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The mind and so forth are explained.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'i sngags kyi don gyi brda'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'i sngags kyi don gyi brda'o //
translated: The that is the symbolic meaning of the mantra that is taught.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The om and so forth are explained.

original: de'i nye bar bshad pa ni gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don mdor byas kyi rim par 'phags pas gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i nye bar bshad pa ni gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don mdor byas kyi rim par 'phags pas gsungs so //
translated: The explanation is the three and so forth, the meaning of which is taught by the Arya in the Tantra in brief.

original: gnas ni lus so zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i'o //
analyzed: gnas ni lus so zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i'o //
translated: The place is the body of the yogi.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa gang las mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi lus su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa gang las mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi lus su 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of Akshobhya and so forth is the object of Akshobhya and so forth, from which the body of the form of Akshobhya and so forth is generated.

original: sngags zhes pa la sogs pas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i bkod pa gsum ston par byed do //
analyzed: sngags zhes pa la sogs pas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i bkod pa gsum ston par byed do //
translated: The mantra and so forth teach the three arrangements of Akshobhya and so forth.

original: de dag nyid kyis zhes pa ni spyan ma la sogs pa dang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa dang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i bkod pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis zhes pa ni spyan ma la sogs pa dang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa dang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i bkod pa gsum mo //
translated: The by those very ones refers to the three arrays of LocanƒÅ, etc., Ak·π£hobhya, etc., and Ak·π£hobhya, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i byin rlabs mdor bstan no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i byin rlabs mdor bstan no //
translated: Then, etc. indicates the brief indication of the perfection stage consecration.

original: re re zhing zhes pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa drug kyang gsum por bshad de /
analyzed: re re zhing zhes pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa drug kyang gsum por bshad de /
translated: Each indicates that the six, Vairochana, etc., are explained as the three.

original: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje nyid kyis so //
translated: It is because of the vajra of body, etc.

original: rim pa @84b zhes pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
analyzed: rim pa @84b zhes pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
translated: In order means body, speech, and mind.

original: rim pa min pa ni thugs dang sku dang gsung zhe grung pa'i mthar gsungs so //
analyzed: rim pa min pa ni thugs dang sku dang gsung zhe grung pa'i mthar gsungs so //
translated: Out of order means mind, body, and speech, as stated in the Hevajra Tantra.

original: bdag po'i chos can gcig tu byang //
analyzed: bdag po'i chos can gcig tu byang //
translated: The lord's attribute is one-sided.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag po ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag po ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The lord is Ak·π£hobhya.

original: de'i yon tan du gyur pa nyed kyis sku dang gsung ri re ba nyid de'i chos can te de'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yon tan du gyur pa nyed kyis sku dang gsung ri re ba nyid de'i chos can te de'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body and speech of that one are his attribute, because they are his qualities, and because they are under his control.

original: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: The extensive explanation of this is stated:

original: rdo rje gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnal 'byor pa'i lus la brten nas skyes pa'am /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnal 'byor pa'i lus la brten nas skyes pa'am /
translated: The three vajras and so on. The Tathagata is the nature of Akshobhya and so on, born in dependence on the body of the yogi.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis nye bar bstan pa phan tshun ltos pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis nye bar bstan pa phan tshun ltos pa'o //
translated: The mutual dependence of all the Buddhas is the teaching.

original: bskyed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The generation and so on.

original: gang 'dir ye shes gsum ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi'ang spyod yul ma yin pa ma yin nam bdag gi byin gyis brlab pa'i nga rgyal sngon du 'gro bas spyod pa bya'o zhes bya ba de ji ltar gsungs she na ;
analyzed: gang 'dir ye shes gsum ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi'ang spyod yul ma yin pa ma yin nam bdag gi byin gyis brlab pa'i nga rgyal sngon du 'gro bas spyod pa bya'o zhes bya ba de ji ltar gsungs she na ;
translated: Isn't the three wisdoms here not the domain of the yogis of the generation stage? How is it said that the conduct should be done with the pride of self-consecration?

original: skul sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skul sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The consecration of the body and so on is taught. And so on includes the consecration of speech and mind.

original: 'di nyid du gsungs pa'i sngags dang po'i bshad par spyod pa de dang de byas pa de byas pa de dang de nyid yid la gsal lo //
analyzed: 'di nyid du gsungs pa'i sngags dang po'i bshad par spyod pa de dang de byas pa de byas pa de dang de nyid yid la gsal lo //
translated: In the commentary on the first verse of this very tantra, it is said that the conduct is done by that, and that which is done is that very thing made clear in the mind.

original: rgyud gzhan du yang gsungs pa //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan du yang gsungs pa //
translated: It is also said in other tantras: The conduct is done by that, and that which is done is that very thing made clear in the mind.

original: cung zad drod ni thob pa na //
analyzed: cung zad drod ni thob pa na //
translated: When one has attained a little heat,

original: spyod pa bya bar rtogs par bya //
analyzed: spyod pa bya bar rtogs par bya //
translated: one should understand the performance of the conduct.

original: spyod pa longs spyod phyir ma gsungs //
analyzed: spyod pa longs spyod phyir ma gsungs //
translated: The conduct is not taught for the sake of enjoyment,

original: 'jigs pa'i gzugs can zhes bya min //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i gzugs can zhes bya min //
translated: nor is it for the sake of a frightening form.

original: zhes so // brjod par bya ste bskyed pa'i rim pa spyod pa rnams de kho na nyid ma rig pa rnams la'ang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes so // brjod par bya ste bskyed pa'i rim pa spyod pa rnams de kho na nyid ma rig pa rnams la'ang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It should be said that the stage of generation is taught even for those who are ignorant of reality.

original: 'dir spyod pa de longs spyod kyi rgyu ma yin te dmyal ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / yang na dus gsum pa'i rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / rnal 'byor pa rnams mnyes pas bsod nams kyi tshogs ches rgya che bsgrub pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir spyod pa de longs spyod kyi rgyu ma yin te dmyal ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / yang na dus gsum pa'i rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / rnal 'byor pa rnams mnyes pas bsod nams kyi tshogs ches rgya che bsgrub pa'i don to //
translated: Here, that conduct is not a cause of enjoyment, because it is a cause of hell, and also because it is a cause of the enjoyment of the three times, by accomplishing the vast accumulation of merit through pleasing the perfect buddhas, bodhisattvas, and yogins.

original: phyir rol gyi me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa yang lha mnyes pa'i mchod pa byed par mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bus mngon par 'brel bar brjod par bya'o //

original: lus gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lus gnas pa'o //

original: 'dir phung po gnas pa ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir phung po gnas pa ci bya zhe na /

original: da ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje'i rigs kyi khro bo rnams zhes pa la 'di ltar gtse bar gyis shig ces bya ba gang yin pa'i bka' lung thob pa rnams so //

analyzed: mthong ba ni khong du chud pa'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir rgyu las skyes pa ma yin pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni /

analyzed: rtsa ba'i mdo ru spyod pa thams cad kyi mchog yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba gsang ba bzhi'i khyad par ro //

original: de la nges pa'i don ston par byed pa bshad pa'i rgyud du gsungs pa la yang spyod mchog dag pa kun zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis khyad par te /

translated: In the explanatory tantra that teaches the definitive meaning, the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs special feature is called ‚Äúpure supreme conduct.‚Äù

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni spyod pa thams cad kyi mchog kun nas dag ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: skad cig thang cig ces pa la sogs pa la skad cig ces bya ba se gol gtogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: skad cig thang cig ces pa la sogs pa la skad cig ces bya ba se gol gtogs pa'i gnas skabs so //

analyzed: thang cig yungs kar skor ro'o //

original: yud tsam ni lag pa brdabs pa'o //
analyzed: yud tsam ni lag pa brdabs pa'o //
translated: A short time is the time to clap one‚Äôs hands.

original: grangs gsum ni bskal pa'i grangs ni ngo bo gsum mo //
analyzed: grangs gsum ni bskal pa'i grangs ni ngo bo gsum mo //

analyzed: gcig ni bskal pa'i grangs gang yin pa de de bzhin no //

analyzed: de nyid yin ni mngon par byang chub pa'i skad ci gcig ni zla ba drug tu bshad par 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: skad cig de nyid yang dag par sbyar bar bya ste slar yang ma yin no zhes pa'o //

analyzed: dngos med rdzogs par longs spyod pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //

original: gang gi phyir skad cig gcig nyid du gsungs pa'i skad cig la sogs pa dus kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
