translated: Because the moment and so on, which are said to be in one moment, have the nature of time and are the cause of manifest enlightenment.

original: bsngags pa ni rab tu bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: bsngags pa ni rab tu bsngags pa'o //
translated: Praise is highly praised.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum 'das pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum 'das pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The three times such as the past have the nature of the past.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i skad cig gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i skad cig gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the moment of becoming endowed with form and so forth,

original: byed pa po ni dge bsgom par byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mchod chen de ni byas nas su'o //
analyzed: byed pa po ni dge bsgom par byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mchod chen de ni byas nas su'o //
translated: the creator, having made the great worship of the Tathagatas and so forth,

original: 'dir ci byas nas she na /
analyzed: 'dir ci byas nas she na /
translated: what is done here?

original: gsang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The secret, etc.

original: yul zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsang ba'i mchod pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsang ba'i mchod pa ston par byed do //
translated: The object, etc. teaches the secret worship.

original: @90a * // yul dang dbang po zhes pa nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: @90a * // yul dang dbang po zhes pa nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The object and sense faculty are the illustration.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam shes kyang nye bar mtshon te gsum po 'di rnams sems pa med pa nyid ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam shes kyang nye bar mtshon te gsum po 'di rnams sems pa med pa nyid ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: The consciousness is also illustrated by that. The non-existence of thought in these three is the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: ci zhen gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci zhen gsungs pa /
translated: What is it? It is said:

original: bshad ces pa la sogs pa ste de 'dra ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bshad ces pa la sogs pa ste de 'dra ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The explanation, etc. This is the ultimate nature.

original: dngos grub ni zung 'jug gi bdag 'di can nyid do //
analyzed: dngos grub ni zung 'jug gi bdag 'di can nyid do //
translated: The power is the very nature of this union.

original: bza' ba ni zung 'jug gi bdag nyid can nyid kyis bdag tu 'dzin pa za bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bza' ba ni zung 'jug gi bdag nyid can nyid kyis bdag tu 'dzin pa za bar byed pa'o //
translated: Food is the eater of the self, because of the nature of union.

original: rnam rtog med pa ni zung 'jug la mngon par zhen pa por ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa ni zung 'jug la mngon par zhen pa por ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Non-conceptual is the one who is free from the clinging to union.

original: rnam rtog med pa can zhes pas zung 'jug gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa can zhes pas zung 'jug gi khyad par ro //
translated: The one who is non-conceptual is the distinction of union.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That itself, etc.

original: byang chub sems gcig las byung ba ni de bzhin nyid gcig las byung ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i rim pas 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems gcig las byung ba ni de bzhin nyid gcig las byung ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i rim pas 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Arisen from the one mind of enlightenment is arisen from the one suchness.

original: bshad gci la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad gci la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain feces, urine, etc.,üîΩit is said:

original: sha rnams dgongs pas bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: sha rnams dgongs pas bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The flesh, etc., is explained by the intention.üîΩThe word mƒÅna is the word for MƒÅmakƒ´, having removed the two final letters, and having added the nasal sound.

original: m'a ni zhes pa m'a ma k'i'i sgra la mtha'i yi ge gnyis po phyis nas rjes su nga ro 'ongs par byas pa'o zhes pa ni mig gi sgras m'a ma ka'i gsungs te /
analyzed: m'a ni zhes pa m'a ma k'i'i sgra la mtha'i yi ge gnyis po phyis nas rjes su nga ro 'ongs par byas pa'o zhes pa ni mig gi sgras m'a ma ka'i gsungs te /
translated: The eye is said to be MƒÅmakƒ´.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi chogs so //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi chogs so //
translated: This is the collection of etymologies.

original: de bzhin du sa'i sgras mngon par byang chub pa'i rdo rje ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa'i sgras mngon par byang chub pa'i rdo rje ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Likewise, the word ‚Äúearth‚Äù refers to Vajra-Enlightenment, that is, Vajrasattva.

original: bsam gtan de ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bsam gtan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan de ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bsam gtan no //
translated: That meditation is the meditation of wisdom and means.

original: dga' ba zhes pa ni bde ba zag pa med pa'i zas so //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes pa ni bde ba zag pa med pa'i zas so //
translated: ‚Äú Joy‚Äù is the food of undefiled bliss.

original: nang mngon par brjod nas phyi'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nang mngon par brjod nas phyi'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having described the inner, he speaks of the outer: ‚Äúspace,‚Äù etc.

original: de nyid bde ba'i ngo bo'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: de nyid bde ba'i ngo bo'i bsam gtan no //
translated: That itself is the meditation of the nature of bliss.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba du ma la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chen po nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i 'gro ba du ma la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chen po nyid thob pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúgreat‚Äù because it pervades the many moving and unmoving beings, like space.

original: sha chen po zhes gsungs pa'i rim pas sha chen po bza' ba de yis gzhan ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sha chen po zhes gsungs pa'i rim pas sha chen po bza' ba de yis gzhan ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In the sequence of the statement ‚Äúeat the great flesh,‚Äù what is the other that is to be done by that eating of the great flesh?

original: gsungs pa / 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa la rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid ni go 'phang mchog go //
analyzed: gsungs pa / 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa la rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid ni go 'phang mchog go //
translated: He says, ‚Äúaccomplishment,‚Äù etc. Great Vajradhara is the supreme state.

original: sha bzhi po'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: sha bzhi po'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: Having described the four meats, he speaks of the four nectars:

original: chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The great one, etc.

original: khyi la sogs pa'i sogs kyi sgra las /
analyzed: khyi la sogs pa'i sogs kyi sgra las /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in ‚Äúdogs, etc.‚Äù

original: ba lang gi sha gzung ngo //
analyzed: ba lang gi sha gzung ngo //
translated: includes the flesh of cows.

original: grangs kyi dgongs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: grangs kyi dgongs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The intention of the number is stated:

original: phung po zhes pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: phung po zhes pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: The aggregates are the five aggregates of form, etc.

original: grangs mnyam pa'o zhes @90b pa ni sha dang phung po dag go //
analyzed: grangs mnyam pa'o zhes @90b pa ni sha dang phung po dag go //
translated: The number is equal, that is, the flesh and the aggregates.

original: phung po de rnams spyo bar ni rnal 'byor gang zhig go //
analyzed: phung po de rnams spyo bar ni rnal 'byor gang zhig go //
translated: The yogi who is going to scold those aggregates

original: de gnyis su med par gyur pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni zas so //
analyzed: de gnyis su med par gyur pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni zas so //
translated: is the contemplation of the nonduality of those two.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba gcig ni dga' ba'i ngo bo zas so zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba gcig ni dga' ba'i ngo bo zas so zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The one called ‚Äújoy‚Äù is the food that is the nature of joy.

original: gang zhig kham gyis thun mong du zab de ni 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig kham gyis thun mong du zab de ni 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: The food that is eaten in common by mouthfuls is mundane.

original: dga' ba'i zas kyang 'jig rten las 'das par byed do //
analyzed: dga' ba'i zas kyang 'jig rten las 'das par byed do //
translated: Joy is also made supramundane.

original: 'jig rten pa gang yin pa de nyid ni dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa gang yin pa de nyid ni dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is mundane becomes joy.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog gang yin pa ni de bzhin nyid du rang bzhin gcig pa'i zung 'jug gi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog gang yin pa ni de bzhin nyid du rang bzhin gcig pa'i zung 'jug gi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The supreme supramundane is the concentration of union, which is of one nature in reality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'khor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSamsara and nirvana‚Äù and so forth.

original: brtul zhugs bzang po ni rdo rje theg pa'i brtul zhugs mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs bzang po ni rdo rje theg pa'i brtul zhugs mdzes pa'o //
translated: Good conduct is the beautiful conduct of the Vajrayana.

original: blo can ni shes rab rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: blo can ni shes rab rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The wise are those who possess the two kinds of wisdom.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug ni 'dod pa la chags pa rnams kyi mgon po'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug ni 'dod pa la chags pa rnams kyi mgon po'o //
translated: The lord of the desire realm is the protector of those attached to desire.

original: dam tshig yin phyir zhes pa ni drang ba'i don du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig yin phyir zhes pa ni drang ba'i don du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the pledge means because of the explanation of the provisional meaning.

original: dam tshig mchog ni gnyis su med pa'i lam gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dam tshig mchog ni gnyis su med pa'i lam gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The supreme pledge is the essence of the path of nonduality.

original: thun mong pa zhes pa ni drang ba'i don gyis bskyed pa'i rim pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong pa zhes pa ni drang ba'i don gyis bskyed pa'i rim pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The common means those who possess the creation stage of the provisional meaning.

original: rnal 'byor pa mchog ni rin po che'i gang zag rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa mchog ni rin po che'i gang zag rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The supreme yogis are the jewel-like persons who abide in the completion stage.

original: yang dag par bstan nas zhes ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan nas zhes ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving taught‚Äù means

original: ji ltar rigs par rtul ba la sogs pa'i thun mong gis kyang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par rtul ba la sogs pa'i thun mong gis kyang ngo //
translated: that it is also common to the practice of the creation stage and so forth.

original: sngags kyi spyod pa zhes pa sngags pa ni lha ru brjod par bya zhes pa'i rig pas sngags ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa zhes pa sngags pa ni lha ru brjod par bya zhes pa'i rig pas sngags ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe conduct of mantra‚Äù is explained by the statement ‚Äúmantra is said to be the deity.‚Äù

original: de'i sgo nas spyod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas spyod pa ni /
translated: The conduct that is by means of that

original: sngags kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: is the conduct of mantra.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa thun mong gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa thun mong gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is said, ‚Äúcommon‚Äù and so forth.

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dod pa lnga po bsten pa la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa nyid ni 'dod pa'i khams dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dod pa lnga po bsten pa la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa nyid ni 'dod pa'i khams dang mthun pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù and so forth. The natural engagement in the enjoyment of the five objects of desire is in accord with the desire realm.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor bas sems kyi khang par yongs su bzung ste goms pa yid la byas nas de rnams bsten bzhin par zhes pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩspros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor bas sems kyi khang par yongs su bzung ste goms pa yid la byas nas de rnams bsten bzhin par zhes pa la sogs pa'o // spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the yogi/nƒ´ should take them into the house of the mind, make them familiar, and bring them to mind.üîΩ‚ÄúThe elaborate conduct‚Äù is

original: spyod bsdus su gsungs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: spyod bsdus su gsungs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: according to the stages taught in the Compendium of Practice.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spyod bsdus su 'dir dpal gsang ba 'dus par spros pa med pa dang shin @91a * //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spyod bsdus su 'dir dpal gsang ba 'dus par spros pa med pa dang shin @91a * //
translated: As such and so forth. In the Compendium of Practice, it says: In the glorious Guhyasamaja, the nonelaborate and the very unelaborate are taught in the first chapter, and the elaborate is taught in the second chapter.

original: tu spros pa med pa 'ba' zhig nges par bstan no zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam de dag ci ltar spros pa dang bcas pa zhes bya zhe na /üîΩ'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tu spros pa med pa 'ba' zhig nges par bstan no zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam de dag ci ltar spros pa dang bcas pa zhes bya zhe na / 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: As for thus, and so forth, in the Compendium of Practice it says, In this glorious Guhyasamaja, is it not taught that only the unelaborated and the very unelaborate are to be practiced? How can they be called elaborate?

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro ma sgyu ma bde mchog la sogs pa'i rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i spros bcas kyi spyod pa la ltos nas spyod bsdus su gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro ma sgyu ma bde mchog la sogs pa'i rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i spros bcas kyi spyod pa la ltos nas spyod bsdus su gsungs so //
translated: Here it is said, It is taught in the Compendium of Practice in dependence upon the elaborate conduct taught in other tantras, such as the dakini Tantras of Khecari and Maya Sucaritara.

original: 'dir ni smos pa tsam du bstan pas rgyud gzhan du rgyas par gsungs pa 'dir ltos par bstan pa'i don du spros pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni smos pa tsam du bstan pas rgyud gzhan du rgyas par gsungs pa 'dir ltos par bstan pa'i don du spros pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Here it is taught by mere mention, and the meaning of the statement elaborate and so forth is that it is taught in dependence upon the extensive teachings in other tantras.

original: bdag nyid 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes pa ni rnam pa gzhan du sdug bsngal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir de dag kyang 'dir bkag pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes pa ni rnam pa gzhan du sdug bsngal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir de dag kyang 'dir bkag pa'o //
translated: The phrase in accordance with one's desire is a prohibition against the other form of sexual intercourse, which would be painful for the other person.

original: bdag ste rang nyid ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bdag ste rang nyid ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The phrase one's own self means the nature of all the Buddhas.

original: gzhan la yang ni gdul bya rnams la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang ni gdul bya rnams la'o //
translated: The phrase in others means in those who are to be converted.

original: tshim par bya'o ni bde bas mgu bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshim par bya'o ni bde bas mgu bar bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase one should satisfy means one should delight them with bliss.üîΩThe phrase one's own deity and so on teaches that the spiritual practitioner should practice in relation to that deity of the five clans such as Akshobhya, etc., upon whom he is focused.üîΩThe phrase one should practice in relation to the deity means that one should practice in relation to the deity who is the object of one's faith.

original: rang gi lha zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa gang gi mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rigs lnga'i lha gang yin pa de la dmigs pa'i spyod pa bya'o zhes nye bar bstan to //üîΩsprul pa kun rdzob pa yis sku //üîΩji lta ji ltar 'dod longs spyod //
analyzed: rang gi lha zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa gang gi mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rigs lnga'i lha gang yin pa de la dmigs pa'i spyod pa bya'o zhes nye bar bstan to // sprul pa kun rdzob pa yis sku // ji lta ji ltar 'dod longs spyod //
translated: The phrase one should practice in relation to the deity means that one should practice in relation to the deity who is the object of one's faith.üîΩThe phrase one should practice in relation to the deity means that one should practice in relation to the deity who is the object of one's faith.üîΩThe phrase one should practice in relation to the deity means that one should practice in relation to the deity who is the object of one's faith.üîΩThe phrase one should practice in relation to the deity means that one should practice in relation to the deity who is the object of one's faith.üîΩThe phrase one should practice in relation to the deity means that one should practice in relation to the deity who is the object of one's faith.üîΩThe phrase one should practice in relation to the deity means that one should practice in relation to the deity who is the object of one's faith.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase one should practice in relation to the deity means that one should practice in relation to the deity who is the object of one's faith.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal las longs pa sprul pa'i sku zhugs pas sprul pa'i sku yang ye shes kyi sku dang gnyis su med pa nyid kyis sgyu ma lta bu yongs su dag pa'i ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal las longs pa sprul pa'i sku zhugs pas sprul pa'i sku yang ye shes kyi sku dang gnyis su med pa nyid kyis sgyu ma lta bu yongs su dag pa'i ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid
translated: ‚ÄúBy the samƒÅdhi of illusion-like‚Äù means that since the enjoyment body enters the emanation body from the clear light, the emanation body is also the nature of the completely pure body of gnosis that is illusion-like because it is nondual with the body of gnosis.

original: can nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi dbye ba yang ngo //
analyzed: can nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi dbye ba yang ngo //
translated: Therefore it is also the division of nature.

original: de bzhin du ni 'phags pas sh'akya seng ge la bstod par /üîΩkhong stong khyod kyi sku la med//
analyzed: de bzhin du ni 'phags pas sh'akya seng ge la bstod par / khong stong khyod kyi sku la med//
translated: Similarly, in the Praise of the Lion of the ≈öƒÅkyas, the noble one says:üîΩYour body is not hollow.

original: sha dang rus pa khrag med kyang //üîΩnam mkha' la ni 'ja' tshon la //
analyzed: sha dang rus pa khrag med kyang // nam mkha' la ni 'ja' tshon la //
translated: Although there is no flesh, bone, or blood,

original: khyod kyi sku ni ston par mdzad //
analyzed: khyod kyi sku ni ston par mdzad //
translated: Your body is displayed in the skyüîΩLike a rainbow.

original: sku la snyun med mi gtsang med //
analyzed: sku la snyun med mi gtsang med //
translated: Your body is without illness and without impurity.

original: bkres dang skom pa byung med kyang //üîΩkhyed kyis 'jig rten rjes 'jug don //
analyzed: bkres dang skom pa byung med kyang // khyed kyis 'jig rten rjes 'jug don //
translated: Although hunger and thirst do not occur,üîΩYou follow the world for the sake of the world

original: 'jig rten bya ba ston par mdzad //
analyzed: 'jig rten bya ba ston par mdzad //
translated: And display worldly activities.

original: ces so // de nyid kyi phyir sku gsum yang dbye ba dang dbye ba med pa dag tu gsungs pa ni rnam grangs pa ste /
analyzed: ces so // de nyid kyi phyir sku gsum yang dbye ba dang dbye ba med pa dag tu gsungs pa ni rnam grangs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the three bodies are also said to be both differentiated and undifferentiated.

original: gdul bya'i rjes su mthun pas kyang dbye ba nye bar bstan no zhes so //üîΩlus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gdul bya'i rjes su mthun pas kyang dbye ba nye bar bstan no zhes so // lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In accordance with the disciples, the differentiation is also taught.

original: gtsug lag khang du 'khyams pa la sogs pa lus gdung bar byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du 'khyams pa la sogs pa lus gdung bar byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The body is tormented by the cause of wandering in the temple, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgra las gcer bu la sogs @91b bsdus so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra las gcer bu la sogs @91b bsdus so //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the naked, etc.

original: shing drung pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩgcig gnyis zhes pa ni shing drung dang blag ba med pa dang / gzhi ji bzhin ba dang / stan gcig pa dang / cog pu pa dang / dur khrod pa dang / phyag dar khrod pa dang / 'phying pa pa dang / chos gos gsum pa dang /
analyzed: shing drung pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / gcig gnyis zhes pa ni shing drung dang blag ba med pa dang / gzhi ji bzhin ba dang / stan gcig pa dang / cog pu pa dang / dur khrod pa dang / phyag dar khrod pa dang / 'phying pa pa dang / chos gos gsum pa dang /
translated: The tree-root-dweller, etc.üîΩThe one-two refers to the tree-root-dweller, the open-space-dweller, the just-as-received-user, the one-sitting-meal-eater, the bowl-food-eater, the charnel-ground-wearer, the rag-robe-wearer, the three-robe-wearer, the alms-food-eater, the forest-dweller, and the not-taking-food-after-the-time.

original: bsod snyoms pa dang / dgon pa ba dang / yang phyis mi len pa ste sbyangs pa'i yon tan gcig gnyis so //
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa dang / dgon pa ba dang / yang phyis mi len pa ste sbyangs pa'i yon tan gcig gnyis so //
translated: These are the one-two ascetic practices.

original: de'i tshul khrims ni shing drung du gnas pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i tshul khrims ni shing drung du gnas pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: His morality is the dwelling at the foot of a tree, etc.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The literal meaning.

original: slong mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la slong mo za bar byed pa nyid kyi dang tshul gang yin pa de ni slong mo za ba'o //
analyzed: slong mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la slong mo za bar byed pa nyid kyi dang tshul gang yin pa de ni slong mo za ba'o //
translated: The one who is the very nature of the practice of begging is the beggar.

original: des brjod par mi bya'o zhes pa ni ngag gi bzlas pa la ltos nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: des brjod par mi bya'o zhes pa ni ngag gi bzlas pa la ltos nas bshad pa'o //
translated: He should not speak, this is explained in terms of the repetition of speech.

original: dman pa la 'jug pa rnams kyis ni lo ma dang rtsa ba dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dman pa la 'jug pa rnams kyis ni lo ma dang rtsa ba dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Those who are engaged in the inferior should do so with leaves, roots, fruits, etc.

original: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni sdong bu dang rtsa ba dang 'bras bu rnams kyi thams cad la longs spyod cing bza'o //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni sdong bu dang rtsa ba dang 'bras bu rnams kyi thams cad la longs spyod cing bza'o //
translated: The practice without elaboration is to enjoy and eat everything, such as the trunk, roots, and fruits.

original: mnyam par spyad par bya zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'di la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: mnyam par spyad par bya zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'di la 'gal ba med de /
translated: One should practice equally, this is not contradictory to what will be explained,

original: 'dir spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because here it is the occasion of the practice with elaboration.

original: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzlas pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzlas pa ston par byed do //
translated: He should do repetition, etc. with such, etc.

original: yang ba ni dmyal ba'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: yang ba ni dmyal ba'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The light is the fault of hell.

original: de rnams ma spangs te ma btang bas so //
analyzed: de rnams ma spangs te ma btang bas so //
translated: They are not abandoned, not given up.

original: dus byas nas ni 'chi bar byas nas zhes de dag nye bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dus byas nas ni 'chi bar byas nas zhes de dag nye bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Having made time, having died, they should be understood as such.

original: drang ba'i don no //
analyzed: drang ba'i don no //
translated: The interpretable meaning.

original: tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pa la tha dad kyang yin la yi ge'ang yin pas tha dad rnam pa'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pa la tha dad kyang yin la yi ge'ang yin pas tha dad rnam pa'i yi ge'o //
translated: Different, etc. Different and also letters are different-aspect letters.

original: rnam pa dang yi ge dag tha du rnam par rtog pa ni slong mo'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang yi ge dag tha du rnam par rtog pa ni slong mo'o //
translated: The conceptualization of aspects and letters is begging.

original: de 'don pa ste brjod pas bzlas par byed pa ni za ba'o //
analyzed: de 'don pa ste brjod pas bzlas par byed pa ni za ba'o //
translated: By reciting that, by expressing it, one performs repetition, which is eating.

original: de dag ces pa bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces pa bshad pa rnams so //
translated: Those are the explanations.

original: mi 'dod ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: Not desired is by Great Vajradhara, the remainder.

original: rdo rje theg pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: In terms of the Vajra Vehicle, it is said:

original: dbugs 'byung zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩdbugs 'byung ba ni phyir 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung zhes pa la sogs pa ste / dbugs 'byung ba ni phyir 'byin pa'o //
translated: Breath, etc.üîΩExhaling is going out.

original: rngub pa ni sdud pa'o zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rngub pa ni sdud pa'o zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: Inhaling is gathering, the remainder.

original: rnal 'byor ni brtags pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni brtags pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Yoga is the imagined aspect.

original: de gang la yod pa de rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: He who has that is a yogi.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äújust as it is said,‚Äù and so forth.

original: shes rab @92a * //
analyzed: shes rab @92a * //
translated: Wisdom

original: thabs kyi gzhir zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can dag gi gnyir te /
analyzed: thabs kyi gzhir zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can dag gi gnyir te /
translated: The basis of means is the two, having the nature of outer and inner.

original: sgom pa'i gnas la ngag gi bzlas pa yang dag par bsten pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa'i gnas la ngag gi bzlas pa yang dag par bsten pa'o //
translated: In the place of meditation, one should rely on verbal recitation.

original: 'dir grangs kyang bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa khri phrag ces pa la sogs pa ste nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir grangs kyang bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa khri phrag ces pa la sogs pa ste nges pa'i don to //
translated: Here, in order to teach the number, it is said, ‚Äúten thousand,‚Äù and so forth. This is the definitive meaning.

original: chos ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can phung po la sogs pa chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can phung po la sogs pa chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Dharma is conventional truth, because the aggregates and so forth, having the nature of outer and inner, are the essence of Dharma.

original: mi g-yo ni mi 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ni mi 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Immovable is ultimate truth, because it is indestructible.

original: mnyam par 'jog par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes pa ni zab mo lhag par mos pa 'dod pa lnga la zhen pa rnams so //
analyzed: mnyam par 'jog par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes pa ni zab mo lhag par mos pa 'dod pa lnga la zhen pa rnams so //
translated: Because it does not become the state of equipoise, those who desire profound, special interest are attached to the five objects of desire.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the intention.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes don du gnyer ba 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod pa tsam don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes don du gnyer ba 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod pa tsam don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: The desire for the enjoyment of the mere enjoyment of the desire for the pursuit of nondual intuition.

original: spyod lam thams cad du ni dbang po dang yul dag gzung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam thams cad du ni dbang po dang yul dag gzung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In all deportment, the sense faculties and their objects are apprehended, etc.

original: rtag tu sgom par gsungs pa rtag tu zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu sgom par gsungs pa rtag tu zhes pa'o //
translated: The statement always is the always.

original: mnyes bar bya'o zhes pa ni yul dang shes pa dag bdag med pa'i bde bas so //
analyzed: mnyes bar bya'o zhes pa ni yul dang shes pa dag bdag med pa'i bde bas so //
translated: The statement should be pleased is by the bliss of selflessness of the object and consciousness.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na yul gyi dbang po rnams tshim par gal 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na yul gyi dbang po rnams tshim par gal 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could the sense faculties of the object be satisfied?

original: de'i phyir phung po dang khams la sogs pa rnams kyang de bzhin du tshim par byed pa nyid du bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po dang khams la sogs pa rnams kyang de bzhin du tshim par byed pa nyid du bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the aggregates, elements, etc. are also explained as being satisfiers in the same way. Thus it is said:

original: des sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The satisfaction of K·π£itigarbha, etc.

original: de rnams dang ldan pa'i zhes pa'i zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur bzhin pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams dang ldan pa'i zhes pa'i zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur bzhin pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The statement endowed with those is the Vairocana, etc. that are being explained.

original: byang chub nyi ma zhes pa ni drug pa phyin ci log tu gsungs pa ni lung pa ni lung nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub nyi ma zhes pa ni drug pa phyin ci log tu gsungs pa ni lung pa ni lung nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement that the three are reversed is because the ‚Äúvalley‚Äù is the ‚Äúlung‚Äù itself, and so on.

original: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas so sor sdud pa'i yan lag ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas so sor sdud pa'i yan lag ston to //
translated: The three aspects, etc.üîΩThat itself, etc.

original: de nyid ces pa la sogs pas bsam gtan gyi yan lag ste bzhi ba 'od gsal lo //
analyzed: de nyid ces pa la sogs pas bsam gtan gyi yan lag ste bzhi ba 'od gsal lo //
translated: The limb of concentration is the fourth, clear light.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa rnams la yan lag gnyis po sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa rnams la yan lag gnyis po sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the two limbs should be applied to sound, etc.

original: gsang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The secret, etc.üîΩThe limbs of concentration taught by the BhagavƒÅn are the six divisions of one‚Äôs mind being one-pointed.üîΩThe four limbs of prƒÅ·πáa and ƒÅyƒÅma, etc., will be explained.

original: gsungs pa'i bsam gtan gyi yan lag ni rang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yan lag drug kyang srog rtsol la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhi 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sbas pa la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir @92b 'dir sbyar bar bya'o zhes gsalüîΩbar byed do //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i bsam gtan gyi yan lag ni rang gi sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yan lag drug kyang srog rtsol la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhi 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sbas pa la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir @92b 'dir sbyar bar bya'o zhes gsalüîΩbar byed do //
translated: The hidden, etc., are explained here.

original: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la'o //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: thabs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: With the nature of the means, with the nature of Vairochana, etc.

original: slar yang de rnams nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams nyid do//
analyzed: slar yang de rnams nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams nyid do//
translated: Again, those very ones are the objects of form, etc.

original: spyan ma la sogs pa zhes pa gzugs sgra la sogs pa spyan ma'i ngo bo nyid do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs pa zhes pa gzugs sgra la sogs pa spyan ma'i ngo bo nyid do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The statement ‚Äúwith the nature of Lochana, etc.‚Äù teaches that form, sound, etc. are the nature of Lochana, etc.

original: rgyu mtshan de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For that reason, etc.

original: shes rab spyan ma la sogs pa'i ngo bor bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa spyan ma la sogs pa nyid do zhes nges par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab spyan ma la sogs pa'i ngo bor bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa spyan ma la sogs pa nyid do zhes nges par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on form, etc. with the nature of Lochana, etc. One should ascertain that form, etc. are Lochana, etc.

original: spyan ma la sogs pa bzhi yin la yul rnams kyang lnga ste de dag ci ltar yongs su gyur pas mi mnyam par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs pa bzhi yin la yul rnams kyang lnga ste de dag ci ltar yongs su gyur pas mi mnyam par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: There are four, Lochana, etc., and there are five objects. How is it that they are not unequal in their transformation?

original: m'a ma k'i ni rigs gnyis ka'i thun mong ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i ni rigs gnyis ka'i thun mong ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since MƒÅmakƒ´ is common to both families,

original: sgra dang reg bya nyid yongs su gyur pa ni m'a ma k'i'o zhes pa 'di la nyid pa med do //
analyzed: sgra dang reg bya nyid yongs su gyur pa ni m'a ma k'i'o zhes pa 'di la nyid pa med do //
translated: there is no contradiction in saying that sound and touch are the complete transformation of MƒÅmakƒ´.

original: rnam bde lta bur yongs su gyur par brjod pas //
analyzed: rnam bde lta bur yongs su gyur par brjod pas //
translated: It is said that the complete transformation is like the bliss of sexual union.

original: phyi rol gyi skyes pa dang bud med du rtogs pa'i gzugs rnams sgom par gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skyes pa dang bud med du rtogs pa'i gzugs rnams sgom par gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the external forms of men and women are to be contemplated.

original: da ni slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de rnams nyid mig la sogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams zhes pa ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs ba'i rang gi ngo bo rnams so //
analyzed: da ni slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de rnams nyid mig la sogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa rnams zhes pa ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs ba'i rang gi ngo bo rnams so //
translated: Now, beginning with ‚ÄúAgain, those very ones,‚Äù the objects of the eyes, etc., are the forms of Vajra and so forth, which are the natures of the forms of Vajra and so forth.

original: rigs kyi dbye bas ni rnams par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs lnga pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye bas ni rnams par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs lnga pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The division of families is by the division into the five families of Vairochana and so forth.

original: yongs su gyur pa zhes pa ni gzugs rdo rje las sogs pa bud med du gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po bde ba'i ngo bor dmigs par bya ba ste bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa zhes pa ni gzugs rdo rje las sogs pa bud med du gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po bde ba'i ngo bor dmigs par bya ba ste bsgom par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTotally transformed‚Äù means that one should visualize, should meditate, that Great Vajradhara, the nature of bliss, by the nature of the clarity of the woman from Vajrarupa and so forth.

original: gzugs la sogs rnams thams cad kyis sbyar bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs rnams thams cad kyis sbyar bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: One should apply this to all, such as form and so forth.

original: rnal 'byor thams cad bcom ldan 'das //üîΩzhes pa ni //
analyzed: rnal 'byor thams cad bcom ldan 'das // zhes pa ni //
translated: All yogas are the Bhagavat.

original: bcom pa 'di la yod do zhes pas bcom ldan te /
analyzed: bcom pa 'di la yod do zhes pas bcom ldan te /
translated: The Bhagavat is one who has destroyed, because he has destroyed this, i.e., the afflictions.

original: phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i phyir dang ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i phyir dang ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the Bhagavat because he is endowed with the seal and because he is endowed with intuition.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can drug pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can drug pa ste /
translated: Vajrasattva is the sixth, having the nature of Akshobhya and so forth,

original: yul la longs spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi skabs su bab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbde mchog ces ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro ma sgyu ma bde mchog tu'o //
analyzed: yul la longs spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi skabs su bab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // bde mchog ces ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro ma sgyu ma bde mchog tu'o //
translated: because he is the one who is present in the situation of enjoying the objects.üîΩ‚ÄúSupreme bliss‚Äù is in the Supreme Bliss of the dakinis‚Äô illusion, the union with all buddhas.

original: yid du 'ong ba zhes @93a * //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba zhes @93a * //
translated: ‚ÄúDelightful‚Äù is the supreme bliss of the dakinis‚Äô illusion, the union with all buddhas.

original: pa la sogs pas bsam gtan gyi yan lag gi rab tu dbye ba lnga po ston par byed de //
analyzed: pa la sogs pas bsam gtan gyi yan lag gi rab tu dbye ba lnga po ston par byed de //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate the five divisions of the branches of meditation.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni yid la 'thad pa'o //üîΩyid du mi 'ong ba ni de las cig shos so //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni yid la 'thad pa'o // yid du mi 'ong ba ni de las cig shos so //
translated: Pleasant is agreeable.üîΩUnpleasant is the opposite.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid can yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba nyid brjod du med pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid can yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba nyid brjod du med pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Neutral is that which is not described as either pleasant or unpleasant, because it is the nature of equanimity.

original: rnam pa gsum zhes pa ni sngar brjod pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum zhes pa ni sngar brjod pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The three kinds are the three kinds mentioned above.

original: snang ba gsum ni snang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba gsum ni snang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three appearances are the appearances of form and so on.

original: de las byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi grangs ji lta ba bzhin du yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa'i yul la dmigs par bya'o //üîΩyul du gyur pas shes pa ni yul lo //
analyzed: de las byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi grangs ji lta ba bzhin du yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa'i yul la dmigs par bya'o // yul du gyur pas shes pa ni yul lo //
translated: The objects of the three appearances are the objects of desire and so on, which should be understood as the objects of the three kinds of desire and so on.üîΩThe object of consciousness is the object.

original: mig gi shes pa ni mig dag go //
analyzed: mig gi shes pa ni mig dag go //
translated: The eye consciousness is the eye.

original: rnam par shes par byas la shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid snang ba tsam nyid du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes par byas la shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid snang ba tsam nyid du gsungs pa'o //
translated: Having been made conscious, consciousness is said to be the mere appearance of the characteristic of the experience of consciousness.

original: mchod pa zhes pa la sogs pas mchod pa la sogs pa snang ba rtsam nyid du'o //
analyzed: mchod pa zhes pa la sogs pas mchod pa la sogs pa snang ba rtsam nyid du'o //
translated: By ‚Äúworship‚Äù and so forth, worship and so forth are mere appearances.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can yang rigs thams cad kyi bdag nyid can ni drug pa'o //üîΩbrtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can zhes sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid can nyid kyis //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can yang rigs thams cad kyi bdag nyid can ni drug pa'o // brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can zhes sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid can nyid kyis //
translated: Therefore, and so forth, the sixth is the nature of all the clans, which is the nature of the stable and the moving.

original: drug pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: drug pa ston par byed do //
translated: By the nature of all the Buddhas, the nature of the stable and the moving is taught as the sixth.

original: gsungs pa yang /üîΩye shes gsum ni lnga la bstan pa dang // zhes so //
analyzed: gsungs pa yang / ye shes gsum ni lnga la bstan pa dang // zhes so //

analyzed: sprul pa'i sku yang dag par gzung ba gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sangs rgyas lnga po rnams kyang snang ba gsum gyi nang du gtogs par gsungs pa sangs rgyas pa sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa la sangs rgyas

original: ni drug pa nyid do //
analyzed: ni drug pa nyid do //
translated: The Buddha is the sixth.

original: thim par gyur pa ni gang du de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas par byed do zhes byas so //
analyzed: thim par gyur pa ni gang du de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas par byed do zhes byas so //
translated: Dissolves means where it abides by its own nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: de nyid ces pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po las tha dad pa'i rnal 'byor pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid ces pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po las tha dad pa'i rnal 'byor pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de bzhin nyid du zhes pa ni sngar brjod pa'i gzugs bzhin du //

analyzed: dbul bar bya'o ni snang ba gsum nyid kyis shes par bya'o //

analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can ni sna tshogs dang 'brel pa'i sgra'i bdag nyid can no //

original: de'i ngo bo 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo 'od dpag med do //

original: rang gi rigs kyi ye shes gsum gyi bdag nyid ye shes gsum nyid du dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi ye shes gsum gyi bdag nyid ye shes gsum nyid du dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer the three appearances to the three exalted wisdoms, which have the nature of one‚Äôs own lineage.

analyzed: rang gi ye shes kyi rang gi ye shes la shes par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: mi bskyod pa ni snang ba ste /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa ni snang ba ste /

original: de nyid ces pa rnal 'byor ba de nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces pa rnal 'byor ba de nyid do //

original: rnam par shes pa gsum la sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum la sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa ni /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum dmigs par byed pa'i don to //

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa'o //

analyzed: 'di zhes pa la sogs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i slob dpon rnams la slob pa ste /

original: blangs nas ni bkug nas so//
analyzed: blangs nas ni bkug nas so//

analyzed: bsags pa ni gcig po 'dir ye shes gsum du gyur pa de'i bdag nyid kyi phung por byas pa'o zhes pa'o //

original: spyod bsdus su rnam shes ni phung po'am /
analyzed: spyod bsdus su rnam shes ni phung po'am /

analyzed: bsags par med de gzhi med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /

original: shes bya dang shes pa'i bdag nyid can shes pa ni 'dir so sor bstan par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: shes bya dang shes pa'i bdag nyid can shes pa ni 'dir so sor bstan par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault here, because consciousness, which has the nature of the object of knowledge and the knower, is what is to be shown individually.

original: gang yang phung po lta bu ni phung po'o //
analyzed: gang yang phung po lta bu ni phung po'o //

original: gcig kyang 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: gcig kyang 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa'o //

analyzed: gsungs pa / sngags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa gsum gyi ni yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa rnams kyis so //

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir lha nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir lha nyid do //

analyzed: yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa'i yul gsum rig pa'i phyir ye shes gsum mo //

analyzed: de bzhin du gang phyi la yid du 'ong ba'i yul la chags pa'i rang bzhin no //

original: yid du mi 'ong ba'i yul la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rang @94a * //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba'i yul la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rang @94a * //

original: bzhin no // btang snyoms ba'i yul la gti mug gi rang bzhin skye ba'i dbang gis ye shes gsum yang rtogs so //

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: shes par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: shes par bya'o zhes so //

original: ngo bo nyid du shes pa ni ye shes gsum gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du shes pa ni ye shes gsum gyi ngo bo'o //

original: de bla ma'i man ngag las 'od gsal du shes pa ste /
analyzed: de bla ma'i man ngag las 'od gsal du shes pa ste /
translated: That is known as luminosity through the guru‚Äôs instruction.

original: rnam pa gzhan du rnam par rig par byed pa med pa dang shes ba med pa dang / nyams su myong ba med pa nyid kyis gnod pa'i phyir rnam par rig par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du rnam par rig par byed pa med pa dang shes ba med pa dang / nyams su myong ba med pa nyid kyis gnod pa'i phyir rnam par rig par ga la 'gyur /

original: de rang bzhin gyis yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rang bzhin gyis yongs su gyur pa'o //

original: de nyid ces pa ni ye shes gsum gyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po ni gnyug ma'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ces pa ni ye shes gsum gyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po ni gnyug ma'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù is MahƒÅvajradhara, who has the nature of the three wisdoms, because he is the primordial nature.

original: de'i zhes pa 'dis yongs su dag pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po la 'od gsal ba rdo rje 'chang chen po'i tha snyad btags pa la btags pa'i rgyu mtshan ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa 'dis yongs su dag pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po la 'od gsal ba rdo rje 'chang chen po'i tha snyad btags pa la btags pa'i rgyu mtshan ston par byed do //

original: bshad pa'i rgyud ces pa ni dgongs pa lung ston du'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud ces pa ni dgongs pa lung ston du'o //

original: nang ni ye shes gsum mo ;
analyzed: nang ni ye shes gsum mo ;

original: / phyi rol ni dbang po'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: / phyi rol ni dbang po'i shes pa'o //

original: gnyis ka ni rjes su dmigs par gyur bar kun du 'byung ba'i phyi la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis ka ni rjes su dmigs par gyur bar kun du 'byung ba'i phyi la sogs pa rnams so //

analyzed: gzugs sogs shes pa ni rang bzhin med pa nyid gzugs sogs rnam gsum gyi sgras brjod par bya'o zhes mngon par dgongs so //

analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid yongs su shes pa nyid lha rnams la dbul ba ste /

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

translated: The so-called extremely unelaborate conduct is the pacification of the elaborations of the five sense objects in the state of the three wisdoms or by means of the three wisdoms, because they are brought to the culmination of luminous clarity.üîΩ

original: mthar thug pa'o //üîΩphyis gcig tu byas pa ni //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'o // phyis gcig tu byas pa ni //
translated: The conduct called ‚Äúextremely unelaborate‚Äù is so called because the elaborations of the five sense objects are pacified in the end in clear light, either by their very nature of the three exalted wisdoms or by the three exalted wisdoms themselves.

original: gsum po rnams kyang mtshan ma nyid las so //
analyzed: gsum po rnams kyang mtshan ma nyid las so //
translated: The three are also from the signs.

original: thabs kyi ye shes ni 'od gsal thob pa'i thabs yin pa nyid kyi phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi ye shes ni 'od gsal thob pa'i thabs yin pa nyid kyi phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir lha zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lha zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: chu zla zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe gcig gnyis kyis gsungs pa'i ye shes kyi sku ni lha'i bdag nyid yongs su shes pa'o //

analyzed: bde ba chen po gcig ces bya ba 'dis zung 'jug ni bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid du bstan to //

analyzed: gsungs pa yang /

analyzed: @94b bde dang sdug bsngal zhes pa /

analyzed: gnyis ka sbyin par byed pa rtags //

analyzed: dmigs med bde ba chen po'o //

analyzed: zhes so // thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /

analyzed: nyams dga' ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDelightful‚Äù means pleasing.

analyzed: bha ga la ni bdud bzhi 'joms pa'i sgrub pa la'o // zhi ba gcig bu'i ming zhes pa ni zhi ba ni nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBhaga‚Äù is the practice of conquering the four demons.üîΩ‚ÄúThe name of the single peace‚Äù is the pacification of the single one and so forth.

analyzed: gang du gcig la sogs pa'i ming ngo zhes pas gcig pu'i ming ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe name of the single one‚Äù is the name of the single one.

analyzed: gang du zhes pa yang dag par skyes pa der gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i ming gzhag pa gang du skyes pa zhes mngon par dgongs so //

original: rang gi de nyid ni 'od gsal lo //
analyzed: rang gi de nyid ni 'od gsal lo //

original: de'i phyir gnyis su med pa nyid kyis ni bdag nyid gcig pu nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis su med pa nyid kyis ni bdag nyid gcig pu nyid kyis so //
translated: Therefore, by nonduality, by oneness,

analyzed: byung zhes pas rang gi ngo bo ston par byed do //

original: rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //

original: sbyar bar bya ba ni shes par bya ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sbyar bar bya ba ni shes par bya ba'o zhes pa'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran sbyor bas te ni kun du sbyor bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: gzhug pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de las zhes pa rdo rje 'chang chen po gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid can gsungs pa las so ;

analyzed: / rnam spro bya ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam pas spro bar bya ste phyi rol du spro bar bya'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs blo ldan ni spro bar mngon par shes pa'o //

analyzed: spro ba'i sgo gsungs pa ba spu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: gcig spro ba'i dbang nyid kyis ba spu'i bu ga la'o //
analyzed: gcig spro ba'i dbang nyid kyis ba spu'i bu ga la'o //
translated: By the power of emanating one, in the pores.

original: ci zhe na sangs rgyas sprin rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ci zhe na sangs rgyas sprin rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What? The clouds of buddhas, etc.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //

original: rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All yogis,

original: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa la @95a * //
analyzed: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa la @95a * //
translated: means those who abide in the creation and completion stages.

original: gnas pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The yogis of Great Vajradhara and so forth.

original: ji ltar rnyed pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar rnyed pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni /

original: 'dis gzhan gsung mgrin pa snyan pa la sogs pa la 'dir nges par ltos par byas ba ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis gzhan gsung mgrin pa snyan pa la sogs pa la 'dir nges par ltos par byas ba ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: means that this does not necessarily depend on the voice, throat, pleasantness, and so forth of another.

original: yan lag ma nyams pa tsam la ni ltos par bya'o zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: yan lag ma nyams pa tsam la ni ltos par bya'o zhes gsungs la /
translated: It is said that it depends on the mere unimpaired limb,

original: yan lag ma nyams pa nyid kyis shes so //
analyzed: yan lag ma nyams pa nyid kyis shes so //
translated: and it is understood by the unimpaired limb itself.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid kyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid kyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: The characteristic of the object of form and so forth is the characteristic of the experience of the object of form and so forth.

original: gang yang bdag nyid mchod pa zhes pa 'di'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: gang yang bdag nyid mchod pa zhes pa 'di'i khyad par ro //

original: yul gyi mtshan nyid ces pa ni yul gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa mchod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul gyi mtshan nyid ces pa ni yul gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa mchod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The characteristic of the object means that the characteristic of the object is the meaning of worship.

original: byin gyis brlabs pas zhes pa ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pas zhes pa ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy consecration‚Äù means by visualization.

original: yul du zhes pa ni yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum rnams la'o //
analyzed: yul du zhes pa ni yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum rnams la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the field‚Äù means in the three aspects of the attractive, etc.

original: rim pa ji lta bar de la dmigs pas rdzogs pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gsum mo zhes so //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bar de la dmigs pas rdzogs pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gsum mo zhes so //
translated: The three natures of passion, etc. are complete by the completion of the visualization of them, in that order.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i zhes pa ni rnal 'byor bzhis rdzogs pa'i skad cig gis rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i zhes pa ni rnal 'byor bzhis rdzogs pa'i skad cig gis rdzogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOf MahƒÅvajradhara‚Äù means by the instant completion of the four yogas.

original: reg rdo rje zhes pa ni 'dir ji ltar rnyed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes sngags pa 'dir sbrel lo //
analyzed: reg rdo rje zhes pa ni 'dir ji ltar rnyed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes sngags pa 'dir sbrel lo //
translated: ‚ÄúTouch Vajra‚Äù means that the mantra ‚Äúwhatever forms, etc. are found here‚Äù is connected here.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu grags pa'o //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas rigs la sogs pa nges par ston par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas rigs la sogs pa nges par ston par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with the transcendent lords‚Äù and so forth teaches the families, etc.

original: phyag rgya gzhan rnams kyi zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs la so so'i sangs rgyas rnams nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya gzhan rnams kyi zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs la so so'i sangs rgyas rnams nyid kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other seals‚Äù are those of the transcendent lords of the Vairochana family.

original: sngags mchog tu gzhol ba'i zhes gsungs pa'i phyir nang la mchog tu gzhol ba rnams kyi gzhan du 'dir cho ga gzhan du mngon par 'dod de rgya cher bshad pa med pa zhes mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags mchog tu gzhol ba'i zhes gsungs pa'i phyir nang la mchog tu gzhol ba rnams kyi gzhan du 'dir cho ga gzhan du mngon par 'dod de rgya cher bshad pa med pa zhes mtshon par bya'o //
translated: Because it is said, those who are devoted to the supreme mantra, those who are devoted to the supreme inner [mantra] should understand that the rite is elsewhere, and that there is no extensive explanation here.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi nga rgyal dang ldan pas zhes pa ni bde ba'i bdag nyid tshor ba'i phung po la'o //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi nga rgyal dang ldan pas zhes pa ni bde ba'i bdag nyid tshor ba'i phung po la'o //
translated: Having the pride of Ratnasa·πÉbhava means [having the pride] of the aggregate of feeling, which is the nature of pleasure.

original: rnal 'byor brtan par bya'i don du rengs par bya ba'i don du h'um gi yi ge'i glu dang dga' ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor brtan par bya'i don du rengs par bya ba'i don du h'um gi yi ge'i glu dang dga' ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: For the sake of stabilizing the yoga, for the sake of immobilizing, there is the song of the syllable h≈´·πÉ, and there is joy.

original: 'di'i 'bras bu gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di'i 'bras bu gsungs pa /
translated: The result of this is stated:

original: rang gi phyag rgya zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said, one's own consort, and so on.

original: yi ge phat kyi zhes gsungs pa yang phat yig gi brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge phat kyi zhes gsungs pa yang phat yig gi brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is said, with the syllable pha·π≠, and pha·π≠ should be uttered.

original: de zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes pa'o //
translated: That refers to this.

original: snyoms par 'jug pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbang @95b po gnyis tha mal pa'i 'du byed gsal ba'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbang @95b po gnyis tha mal pa'i 'du byed gsal ba'o //
translated: By means of union, and so on, clarifies the ordinary formative forces of the two organs.

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste //
translated: This is an illustration:

original: zhes pa zla ba'i 'od lta bu zhes pa la sogs pas spyan ma la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa zla ba'i 'od lta bu zhes pa la sogs pas spyan ma la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase like the light of the moon and so forth refers to LocanƒÅ and so forth.

original: des rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma yang zla ba'i 'od lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par ro zhes mngon par dgongs so //
analyzed: des rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma yang zla ba'i 'od lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par ro zhes mngon par dgongs so //
translated: It is intended that VajradhƒÅtvƒ´≈õvarƒ´ also is like the light of the moon and so forth.

original: gang yang 'bar bcas zhes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang 'bar bcas zhes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The phrase together with the blazing and so forth refers to the special characteristics.

original: 'di ni m'a ma k'i la sogs pa rnams la yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni m'a ma k'i la sogs pa rnams la yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This also occurs for MƒÅmakƒ´ and so forth.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa ni gsal bar gsungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa ni gsal bar gsungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The phrase not intended is because it is clearly stated.

original: gtso bor phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug pa gsungs pa ni de'i thabs so //
analyzed: gtso bor phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug pa gsungs pa ni de'i thabs so //
translated: The statement of the principal union with the consort is the method for that.

original: don gyi bye brag ston par byed pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor ba la yang sbyar par bya ba nyid de snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don gyi bye brag ston par byed pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor ba la yang sbyar par bya ba nyid de snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since it teaches the distinctions of the meaning, it should be applied to the yoga of the creation stage as well, because this union is stated.

original: rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi thun du zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi thun du zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, at all times of all yogis.

original: ba spu'i bu ga'i rtse bar nas //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: ba spu'i bu ga'i rtse bar nas // zhes pa ni /
translated: From the tips of the pores,

original: mang po nyid du bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: mang po nyid du bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: This is said because it is explained in many places.

original: ba spu zhes pa la sogs pa ste ba spu'i bu ga las dang / ba spu'i rtse mo las dang / ba spu'i bar las spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba spu zhes pa la sogs pa ste ba spu'i bu ga las dang / ba spu'i rtse mo las dang / ba spu'i bar las spro bar bya'o //
translated: From the pores, from the tips of the pores, and from between the pores,  emanate.

original: ngo bo nyid ces pas spro bar bya'o zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces pas spro bar bya'o zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The essence is the remainder of emanate.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni drug pa'o //
translated: The great Vajradhara is the sixth.

original: gsung pa'i 'od dpag med ni spro ba dang bsdu pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsung pa'i 'od dpag med ni spro ba dang bsdu pa gsungs pa /
translated: The Vairochana of speech is the emanation and reabsorption of the speech.

original: chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The cloud of Dharma and so forth are as before.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni drug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni drug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: The Vajrasattva is the sixth, the Vajra Holder.

original: mi bskyod par gsungs pa ni snga ma bzhin du spro ba dang bsdu bar gsungs so //
analyzed: mi bskyod par gsungs pa ni snga ma bzhin du spro ba dang bsdu bar gsungs so //
translated: The Akshobhya is the emanation and reabsorption as before.

original: rdo rje'i sprin zhes bya ba la sogs pas slar yang sangs rgyas rdo rje 'chang chen po drug pa nyid do /
analyzed: rdo rje'i sprin zhes bya ba la sogs pas slar yang sangs rgyas rdo rje 'chang chen po drug pa nyid do /
translated: The vajra cloud and so forth again declares the sixfold Great Vajradhara Buddha.

original: don yod grub par gsungs pa ni snga ma bzhin du spro ba dang bsdu bar gsungs so //
analyzed: don yod grub par gsungs pa ni snga ma bzhin du spro ba dang bsdu bar gsungs so //
translated: The statement of Amoghasiddhi is the same as before, declaring the emanation and withdrawal.

original: khro bo'i sprin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i sprin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
