translated: This is also stated at the end of the third stage, in order to indicate the fourth stage, the analysis and the grasping of the totality.

original: rjes su 'byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: rjes su 'byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir yang ngo //
translated: The analysis, etc., will be explained.

original: sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can ni dam tshig sems dpa' la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can ni dam tshig sems dpa' la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Having the nature of the three beings, that is, having the nature of the commitment being, etc.

original: gcig tu 'gyur zhes pa ni zhal gcig pa phyag gnyis pa'i ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin gcig pa yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig tu 'gyur zhes pa ni zhal gcig pa phyag gnyis pa'i ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin gcig pa yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecome one‚Äù means that the single face and two arms become one, the nature of the gnosis body, completely pure.

original: 'dis mdor byas kyi rim par gsungs pa'i rnal 'byor bzhis rdzogs pa'i dam tshig sems dpa' dang ngag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim par gsungs pa dang sbrel bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis mdor byas kyi rim par gsungs pa'i rnal 'byor bzhis rdzogs pa'i dam tshig sems dpa' dang ngag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim par gsungs pa dang sbrel bar ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that the four yogas taught in the Condensed Tantra are connected with the pledge beings and the blessing process taught in the stage of completion.

original: de yang zhes pa ni 'od gsal zhes gsungs pa'i @116b don gyi rim pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: de yang zhes pa ni 'od gsal zhes gsungs pa'i @116b don gyi rim pa ston par byed do //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the stage of clear light taught in the line ‚Äúclear light.‚Äù

original: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyud gyur pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyud gyur pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: ‚Äú The buddhas‚Äù and so forth refer to the aggregates and so forth that have been transformed.

original: slar yang 'di'i khyad par 'chad pa ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang 'di'i khyad par 'chad pa ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The special features of this are taught by ‚Äúform‚Äù and so forth.

original: de nyid bzhi bstan zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gnas bzhi po phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor 'od gsal la 'jug pa'i gnas ye shes gsum ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid bzhi bstan zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gnas bzhi po phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor 'od gsal la 'jug pa'i gnas ye shes gsum ston par byed do //
translated: Since it is taught that ‚Äúthe four realities are shown,‚Äù the three gnoses are shown to be the stage of entering the clear light of the mandala that has been extracted from the four places.

original: ye shes gsum gyi bdag nyid can longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la ni bar do'i srid pa'i rnam pa la'o //
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyi bdag nyid can longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la ni bar do'i srid pa'i rnam pa la'o //
translated: In the Enjoyment Body, which has the nature of the three intuitions, the form of the intermediate state of existence.

original: rang la zhes pa ni sgrub pa po rab tu 'jug bzhin pa zhes pa ni sgrub pa po rnam gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'jug pa'i gnas ye shes gsum ston par byed do //
analyzed: rang la zhes pa ni sgrub pa po rab tu 'jug bzhin pa zhes pa ni sgrub pa po rnam gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'jug pa'i gnas ye shes gsum ston par byed do //
translated: The own is the adept. Engaging is the three kinds of adepts. And so on indicates the three intuitions, which are the places of engagement of the Enjoyment Body.

original: ye shes de yang 'jug pa'i rim pa'i mtha' brjod pa de dag mnyam par gyur cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ye shes de yang 'jug pa'i rim pa'i mtha' brjod pa de dag mnyam par gyur cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And that intuition is expressed in the limit of the process of engagement, saying they become equalized and so on.

original: rnam par zhu bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par zhu bar gyur pa ni /
translated: The dissolution is as follows:

original: sems ni sems las byung la thim //
analyzed: sems ni sems las byung la thim //
translated: The mind dissolves into the mental factors,

original: sems las byung ba ma rig pa //
analyzed: sems las byung ba ma rig pa //
translated: and the mental factors into ignorance,

original: de'ang 'od gsal bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: de'ang 'od gsal bar 'gro'o //
translated: and that also into clear light.

original: zhes pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rim pas so //
translated: This is the process.

original: brjod pa nyid kyi don der zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: brjod pa nyid kyi don der zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The meaning of the expression in that and so on is as follows:

original: sangs rgyas ni ye shes gsum ste zhes pa de bzhin nyid rtogs pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni ye shes gsum ste zhes pa de bzhin nyid rtogs pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha is the three intuitions, because it is the means of realizing thusness, and because it is the cause of generating the Buddha.

original: ldang bar byed pa de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ldang bar byed pa de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The arising from that is stated as ‚Äúarising from that,‚Äù etc.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can ye shes kyi sku zhes pa ni gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can ye shes kyi sku zhes pa ni gsungs pa yang /
translated: The intuition body, which has the nature of the stable and the moving, is stated as ‚Äúthe intuition body.‚Äù

original: srid gsum rnam par rig pa tsam //
analyzed: srid gsum rnam par rig pa tsam //
translated: The three worlds are mere awareness.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
translated: The nature of things does not exist.

original: zhes so // bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ni /
analyzed: zhes so // bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ni /
translated: According to the thought,

original: gti mug la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bsam pa gang yin pa ni bsam pa ji lta ba'o //
analyzed: gti mug la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bsam pa gang yin pa ni bsam pa ji lta ba'o //
translated: whatever thought has the nature of delusion, etc., is according to the thought.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: For that very reason, it is stated as ‚ÄúVairocana, etc.‚Äù

original: skus zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sprul pas so //
analyzed: skus zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sprul pas so //
translated: The body is Vairocana, etc., emanation.

original: de nyid 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That very thing is the entry, because it is the entry.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sprul pa de rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'am zhes brjod par mi bya ste ye shes kyi sku nyid de bzhin nyid la 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrdo rje 'chang chen po bzhin de rnams kyang gzhan du @117a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sprul pa de rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'am zhes brjod par mi bya ste ye shes kyi sku nyid de bzhin nyid la 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro // rdo rje 'chang chen po bzhin de rnams kyang gzhan du @117a * //
translated: Therefore, it should not be said that those emanations of Vairochana, etc. are not of the nature of consciousness, because the embodiment of gnosis itself enters suchness.

original: sems can gzhan no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gzhan no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Like Great Vajradhara, they should not be said to be ‚Äúother sentient beings.‚Äù

original: sngar med pa'i sems can rab tu 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar med pa'i sems can rab tu 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that sentient beings would appear who did not exist before.

original: rang gi sngags zhes pa la sogs pas yongs su dag pa'i ye shes kyi sku la dmigs par gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi sngags zhes pa la sogs pas yongs su dag pa'i ye shes kyi sku la dmigs par gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own mantra‚Äù and so forth teaches the observation of the embodiment of pure gnosis.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAfter that‚Äù and so forth teaches the emanation body.

original: srog gi rtsol ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa zhes pa mi shigs pa la brten nas srog rtsol bsgom par 'dod bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: srog gi rtsol ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa zhes pa mi shigs pa la brten nas srog rtsol bsgom par 'dod bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe branch of life-force control‚Äù is the meditation on life-force control based on the indestructible drop, because it is the desire to remain just as one is.

original: ham yig rdo rje zhes bya ba /
analyzed: ham yig rdo rje zhes bya ba /
translated: The syllable ‚Äúha‚Äù is the vajra.

original: ham gi yi ge'i ngo bo ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ham gi yi ge'i ngo bo ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The essence of the syllable ham is the essence of Great Vajradhara.

original: brjod du med pa ni 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: brjod du med pa ni 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The inexpressible is the nature of clear light.

original: yul du byas pa ni zhes pa ni yid dang nges par ldan pa mig dag gis gzugs de la rnam par rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul du byas pa ni zhes pa ni yid dang nges par ldan pa mig dag gis gzugs de la rnam par rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: The object is made into the field, because the eye, which is definitely connected with the mind, conceptualizes that form.

original: de nyid du rna bas sgra de dag thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid du rna bas sgra de dag thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is that itself, because the ear hears those sounds.

original: de nyid ni longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni longs spyod pa ste /
translated: That itself is enjoyment,üîΩthe body that is the nature of exalted wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'o zhes pa ni gang zhig rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'o zhes pa ni gang zhig rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa ni /
translated: That which is taught in other tantras is

original: mgrin par longs spyod 'khor lo ni //
analyzed: mgrin par longs spyod 'khor lo ni //
translated: the enjoyment chakra at the throat.

original: mgrin par yang dag rig pa gang //
analyzed: mgrin par yang dag rig pa gang //
translated: That which is at the throat is the perfect knowledge.

original: zhes so // mgrin par longs spyod nyams su myong ba de la longs spyod kyi sgras brjod do /
analyzed: zhes so // mgrin par longs spyod nyams su myong ba de la longs spyod kyi sgras brjod do /
translated: The enjoyment experienced at the throat is expressed by the word enjoyment.

original: de'i phyir na rgyud nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir na rgyud nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is taught in the tantra itself:

original: ro drug rnams kyi gzugs can yang //
analyzed: ro drug rnams kyi gzugs can yang //
translated: It has the form of the six flavors.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do //
translated: And so on.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i tshogs so //
translated: This is the collection of verses.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku nyid du brjod pa gang yin pa de rnams ni /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku nyid du brjod pa gang yin pa de rnams ni /
translated: Those that are described as the Enjoyment Body,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis lhan cig tu 'gal te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis lhan cig tu 'gal te /
translated: are mutually contradictory in the PƒÅramitƒÅnaya.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis 'dir gnod do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis 'dir gnod do //
translated: The PƒÅramitƒÅnaya is contradicted here.

original: 'dir rdo rje theg pa la brjod byar 'brel pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur bshad par bya ba la 'gal ba gang yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje theg pa la brjod byar 'brel pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur bshad par bya ba la 'gal ba gang yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: Here, in the VajrayƒÅna, there is no contradiction whatsoever in explaining the Enjoyment Body as the subject matter.

original: de rnams kyang rim pa gsum par bstan pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mngon par shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyang rim pa gsum par bstan pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mngon par shes pa nyid do //
translated: And those are the Enjoyment Body taught in the third stage, which is the superknowledge itself.

original: rim pa dang por yang dang po'i mgon po ni rnam gzhag rim par klu'i blo'i zhabs kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur byas pa ni rnam par gzhag pa mngon par shes pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa dang por yang dang po'i mgon po ni rnam gzhag rim par klu'i blo'i zhabs kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur byas pa ni rnam par gzhag pa mngon par shes pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: And in the first stage, the first lord is made the Enjoyment Body by the venerable NƒÅgƒÅrjuna in the stages of presentation, which should be understood as the superknowledge itself.

original: ngag rnam par dag pa tsam de dag gir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ngag rnam par dag pa tsam de dag gir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Those are to be described as the mere purity of speech.

original: de thob nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa sprul pa'i sku 'dzin pa 'di ston par byed do //
analyzed: de thob nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa sprul pa'i sku 'dzin pa 'di ston par byed do //
translated: Having attained that, etc. indicates the attainment of the Emanation Body.

original: slar yang ye shes kyi skur brjod pa'i rang gi ngo bo don dam @117b pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: slar yang ye shes kyi skur brjod pa'i rang gi ngo bo don dam @117b pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, the ultimate truth is the nature of the Body of Knowledge, etc.

original: 'od zer bcu ni srog gi rtsol ba la sogs pa rlung bcu'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: 'od zer bcu ni srog gi rtsol ba la sogs pa rlung bcu'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The ten rays are the ten vital airs, such as the life-sustaining air, etc.

original: de la rab tu gnas pa ni rlung dang / rnam par shes pa bskyed par byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rab tu gnas pa ni rlung dang / rnam par shes pa bskyed par byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The abiding in them is the generation of the vital airs and consciousnesses.

original: de ni 'di lta bur 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can dang rlung dang rnam par shes pas bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes mngon par dgongs so //
analyzed: de ni 'di lta bur 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can dang rlung dang rnam par shes pas bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes mngon par dgongs so //
translated: It is like this: the ultimate truth is the nature of the Body of Knowledge, etc.  It is intended that the Body of Knowledge is generated by the two truths, and the Emanation Body is generated by the vital airs and consciousnesses.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation by way of the intended meaning.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: The just explained is the Body of Knowledge, etc.

original: gzung ba'i sprul pa'i sku zhes pa ni shin tu rnal 'byor du gsungs pa'i rim pas thob pa'i sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: gzung ba'i sprul pa'i sku zhes pa ni shin tu rnal 'byor du gsungs pa'i rim pas thob pa'i sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The apprehended Emanation Body is the Emanation Body attained by the process taught in the Yoga Tantra.

original: de la nam mkha'i snying po la sogs pa'i sa bon bkod pas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i snying po la sogs pa'i sa bon bkod pas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The seed syllables of Akashagarbha and so forth are placed there, and the sense bases such as the eyes are purified.

original: de'i sgo nas ni de'i thabs kyis so //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas ni de'i thabs kyis so //
translated: By that means, by that method.

original: 'bras bu gang yin pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yin pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the result of that,

original: dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúfirst,‚Äù and so forth.

original: mig gi sbubs stong par byas pas zhes pa ni mig gi dbang po tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi sbubs stong par byas pas zhes pa ni mig gi dbang po tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe eyes are made empty‚Äù does not refer to the mere eye faculty.

original: de bzhin du skye mched gzhan rnams la yang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye mched gzhan rnams la yang bshad par bya'o //
translated: The other sense bases should be explained in the same way.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis 'bar bar gyur pa zhes pa ni mig gnyis la ltos pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis 'bar bar gyur pa zhes pa ni mig gnyis la ltos pa'i tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThe light rays of the sun and moon blaze forth‚Äù refers to the two eyes.

original: de la mig g-yon pa zla ba'i bdag nyid can nyid kyi phyir zla ba'i 'od zer rnams dang mig g-yas pa nyi ma'i bdag nyid can nyid kyi phyir nyi ma'i 'od zer rnams kyis 'bab par gyur bzhin pa ste dkyil 'khor gyi cho gar ni //
analyzed: de la mig g-yon pa zla ba'i bdag nyid can nyid kyi phyir zla ba'i 'od zer rnams dang mig g-yas pa nyi ma'i bdag nyid can nyid kyi phyir nyi ma'i 'od zer rnams kyis 'bab par gyur bzhin pa ste dkyil 'khor gyi cho gar ni //
translated: There, because the left eye is the nature of the moon, the light rays of the moon enter it. Because the right eye is the nature of the sun, the light rays of the sun enter it.

original: yi ge ta yis mig g-yon zla bar byas //
analyzed: yi ge ta yis mig g-yon zla bar byas //
translated: The letter ta makes the left eye the moon.

original: yi ge ma yis mig g-yas nyi ma dgod //üîΩces so // bsam par bya ba'i sa bon gzhan yang yong ngo zhes 'dis gsal bar byed pa de las byung ba'i zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yi ge ma yis mig g-yas nyi ma dgod // ces so // bsam par bya ba'i sa bon gzhan yang yong ngo zhes 'dis gsal bar byed pa de las byung ba'i zhes pa ni /
translated: The letter ma makes the right eye the sun.

original: thlim gi yi ge las byung ba'i khro bo'i mig gnyis bskyod pas sa'i snying po'i rang bzhin gyis thlim yongs su gyur pa'i mig bsgoms pas /
analyzed: thlim gi yi ge las byung ba'i khro bo'i mig gnyis bskyod pas sa'i snying po'i rang bzhin gyis thlim yongs su gyur pa'i mig bsgoms pas /
translated: The seed of the object of thought is also different. This is clarified by ‚Äúarisen from that,‚Äù which means that the two wrathful eyes arisen from the letter ·π≠hlim shake, and by meditating on the eye that is the transformation of ·π≠hlim, which is the nature of K·π£itigarbha,

original: de las rdzogs pa'i sa'i snying po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de las rdzogs pa'i sa'i snying po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should meditate on the complete K·π£itigarbha.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat Vajradhara‚Äù and so on.

original: sa'i snying po ni sa bcu'i dbang phyug ma yin nam de ci ltar rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar blta zhen /
analyzed: sa'i snying po ni sa bcu'i dbang phyug ma yin nam de ci ltar rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar blta zhen /
translated: Isn‚Äôt K·π£itigarbha the lord of the ten bh≈´mis? How is he to be viewed as similar to Great Vajradhara?

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid ni sa'i snying po'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid ni sa'i snying po'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa yin gyi /
translated: Great Vajradhara is absorbed in the meditative concentration of K·π£itigarbha.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po las gzhan @118a * //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po las gzhan @118a * //
translated: Great Vajradhara is not different from K·π£itigarbha.

original: pa'i snying po ma yin no zhes pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: pa'i snying po ma yin no zhes pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Thus, there is no fault.

original: bshad pa yang thog mar bcom ldan 'das de nyid gdul bya'i skye bo rnams dga' bar bya ba'i don du khang pa brtsegs pa mngon par sprul nas rang gi sku'i phung po la sogs pa rnams spros pa de'i khongs kyi dbus su bzhugs so zhes so //
analyzed: bshad pa yang thog mar bcom ldan 'das de nyid gdul bya'i skye bo rnams dga' bar bya ba'i don du khang pa brtsegs pa mngon par sprul nas rang gi sku'i phung po la sogs pa rnams spros pa de'i khongs kyi dbus su bzhugs so zhes so //
translated: And the explanation is that first, in order to delight the beings to be tamed, the Blessed One emanated the multistoried building, and then he emanated his own body, and so on, and he resided in the center of that building.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: nam mkha' rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he said, ‚Äúthe vajra of space,‚Äù and so on.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po las sa'i snying po gzhan yin par gyur na de bzhin du yang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gnas yin pa'i phyir brjod pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po las sa'i snying po gzhan yin par gyur na de bzhin du yang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gnas yin pa'i phyir brjod pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If K·π£itigarbha were different from Great Vajradhara, then, in the same way, it would follow that there would be the fault of stating that he is the abode of Great Vajradhara.

original: de bzhin du lha'i rna ba la sogs pa'i mngon shes ma tshang ba nyid kyis nyes pa'ang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha'i rna ba la sogs pa'i mngon shes ma tshang ba nyid kyis nyes pa'ang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the fault of the incompleteness of the superknowledges such as the divine ear should be stated.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga dang 'dra ba zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dang 'dra ba zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: The Blessed One is endowed with six superknowledges, is he not?

original: 'dir mngon par shes pa lnga kho na ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa lnga kho na brjod par bya ba slar yang de la gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mngon par shes pa lnga kho na ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa lnga kho na brjod par bya ba slar yang de la gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, only the five superknowledges are taught, so only the five superknowledges are mentioned.üîΩHaving performed the first application,

original: dang po'i sbyor ba byas te zhes pa ni rnal 'byor bzhi la rdzogs pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs su bdag nyid dmigs par bya ba'i don no//
analyzed: dang po'i sbyor ba byas te zhes pa ni rnal 'byor bzhi la rdzogs pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs su bdag nyid dmigs par bya ba'i don no//
translated: means that the meaning of visualizing oneself in the form of perfect Great Vajradhara in the four yogas is below.

original: rnal 'byor bzhi las bskyed pa'i sprul ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po ni bdag nyid kyi 'og tu'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bzhi las bskyed pa'i sprul ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po ni bdag nyid kyi 'og tu'o //
translated: The emanated Great Vajradhara generated from the four yogas is below oneself.

original: dam tshig aom yig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig aom yig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The pledge, the syllable OM, and so forth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor bzhi'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor bzhi'i 'og tu'o //
translated: Therefore, below the four yogas.

original: rdo rje padma 'du bya ba gsungs pa dang / bdud rtsi myang ba la yang snying ga dang / lkog ma sbyang ba gsungs pa de nyid kyi phyir sprul pa'i sku 'dzin pa'i 'og tu mig la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i don du /
analyzed: rdo rje padma 'du bya ba gsungs pa dang / bdud rtsi myang ba la yang snying ga dang / lkog ma sbyang ba gsungs pa de nyid kyi phyir sprul pa'i sku 'dzin pa'i 'og tu mig la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i don du /
translated: The statement that one should perform the vajra lotus, and the statement that one should purify the heart and throat in the rite of tasting the elixir, are for the purpose of purifying the eyes, etc.

original: sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i sa bon lha'i mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dgod par bya'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i sa bon lha'i mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dgod par bya'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, after holding the emanation body, one should understand that one should place the seed of Kshitigarbha, etc., the result of the divine eye, etc., for the purpose of purifying the eyes, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgod pas zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sa bon dgod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgod pas zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sa bon dgod pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúby placing the tathagatas‚Äù means by placing the seeds of the five tathagatas.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pas zhes bya ba ni sgrub thabs su gsungs pa'i rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pas sprul pa'i sku'i gzugs rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs so //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pas zhes bya ba ni sgrub thabs su gsungs pa'i rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pas sprul pa'i sku'i gzugs rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the stage of generation‚Äù means by the stage of generation taught in the sadhana, such as the yoga, subsequent yoga, etc., the emanation body form, the form of Great Vajradhara.
